VItKlQ_bWrma40-iWIQtDw.text: Very disappointed. After living in the middle east for half my life and searching for good middle eastern food in Arizona, I was beyond excited when I heard that New York's beloved Halal Guys will be gracing the streets of Tempe. The meat was ok-ok and lacked flavor. The tabouleh was alright as well. There was nothing special that would want to make me dish out nearly $10 for a bowl. It's overpriced and I would much rather go spend my money for real middle eastern food at Haji Baba or Paradise.

evfk2YpLUT9cAchUYR-ruw.text: Amazing! Their chicken actually tasted better than the halal guys in East Village, NY! No longer need to fly to NYC to get an awesome meal. Wishing it great success! Will be back. Always go for the combo dish. Watch out for the hot sauce..Its deadly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Opening night. Free stuff
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Opening night line

WYCgOhIhYU3Yv4apBy9ayQ.text: Simply amazing!! Thank you for the delicious food and the trip down memory lane-  of my many cold, late night trips to the food cart on 53rd waiting on that long line!! I it!! The food was absolutely incredible!! Literally tastes exactly like the food cart I grew up with!  Thanks for opening up so close to my new home! Moved from the east coast about 3 years ago, and that was one of a few things I missed!

8iZQ7iUoJCqXB5EaU_dcSA.text: The 2nd star is purely for fantastic service. The staff is friendly and very efficient. If you want to try it, get extra tahini. In fact, dip your meal in the white sauce and it might work.   I've had their food in new york and so, my friend and I decided to try it. Luckily we got there before noon for lunch and so didn't have to wait in line. The food was edible but, my friend didn't even bother finishing her meal. The rice had no flavor whatsoever. I like simple menus, but this place has 2 things on their menu. Such a bummer.

rTxIhVJoqTcID0j8JVdikg.text: This place was nothing special.  The hype has already died down and there is no need to worry about waiting in a line.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good but its nothing special.  I won't be begging to come back but if a group of friends want to go I won't resist.  Halal Guys has a reward program that I laughed at when I read the details, you need to get 50 sandwiches to get one free.  Ummm whats the point?  Also the employees don't seem humble when they are working, management will need to figure something out to keep them afloat when they lose the new restaurant traffic.        Return factor 50%

aqbeXYLBScnEWjHBERdnHw.text: WOOOOWWW. This place is literally amazing.  Chipotle + Mediterranean Food + Better Deserts than Chipotle (being that they have some) = Halal Guys. I will literally wait in line for however long it takes, because I love this place so much. I first had it in NYC, and it was great then, and it's even better now because I don't have to go all the way to NYC to get it. There's also usually cute dogs on their patio outside so what is not to love?

aVZU1HuCWMTsE1lwHwVm4w.text: Great look and a very friendly staff! Got the combo plate and a side of hummus that I thought was just okay. I expected this food to be a healthier option than it actually was. Everything was made with soy bean oil, but overall it was delicious!

b-8AoOGlp33i6ZXZ9W78YA.text: Awesome stuff. Just like NYC!! Can't believe I could find the same taste of  New York in Phoenix! The chicken and gyro meat combo with the hot sauce and white sauce just amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. NYC halal guys. In Phoenix!!

ek8OhfFHXdX6uunPZk60dA.text: I ordered rice, salad, falafel, and hummus. Not only was the food very good, the staff was really friendly. I took my time since it was my first time there and they were helpful, not condescending, and warm. The manager, I believe, she was blonde with large pretty lashes and braces, was extremely kind and took in consideration many small details that you see in fine dining. There was another guy with curly short brown hair, tan skin, he was very friendly as well.  Recommend this place based on cleanliness, quick service, and tasty food.

qMHbAZgdUu72w52Wv4E2hA.text: Overrated and underwhelmed... I was so excited to hear that The Halal Guys finally arrived here in Tempe. I got a chance to try them out recently and was very disappointed. Although the staff were very nice, the food was just sad, sad, sad. I had a combo plate with chicken & gyro meet and both were very bland and dry. Their famous white sauce was lacking flavor too. Also the pita bread that came with the combo plate tasted staled. Only thing that somewhat impressed me was their hot sauce. It had real kick but otherwise the food was not tasty at all and portion size was very small for $9. If you want real tasty Middle Eastern food, check out Al-Hana inside Baiz Market Place. So much better.

ZlAV-WEnsrRA7aHMRMQ7Mw.text: Its great that they're open late but their gyro tastes mostly of bread crumbs with hardly amy flavor, their 'white sauce' really needs to taste more like tzatziki than mayonnaise, their rice is okay(can't mess rice up...), something I did like was their hot sauce. Great flavor BUT stupid spicy. Proceed with caution on the hot sauce... And their food in general.   They also have bbq sauce... Wutthef@kchuck... Not exactly traditional. Their condiment choices are white sauce... Bbq sauce... And hot sauce.  Even when I ate here drunk, their food is seriously sub-par. Save yourself the trip is your looking for middle eastern/Mediterranean cuisine.

YZYSfOTIuZzS9j8HklwP0w.text: Tempe location. Across from ASU and next door to Even Stevens and Ahipokibowl(coming soon!)!  Plenty of parking for now. Small store, but fast, efficient and friendly staff. Small & simple menu. Super tasty beef and rice and don't forget the WHITE SAUCE!!! Recommend: combo(beef & chicken),regular size(good portion), rice & white sauce!!! Their baklava was a plus too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baklava-tasty &amp; moist
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo plate( chicken &amp; beef), rice, and their delicious WHITE SAUCE!!

gJUyMwR10hMk3PU1jAK5gQ.text: First time I went it was pretty good. I don't think it compares to the NYC one. Second time, the food tasted a little different, a little "weird." I won't come back again, maybe it was a hit but it left me with a weird taste.   Also, the white sauce is amazing, a bit loaded on the calories.

-Du5ET5jBnzyAymz0rOQyA.text: I've been waiting for this place to open for over a month now! I love that it's open late on thurs fri and sats- 4 am! That's awesome. Seems like they are still working some kinks out with the new employees but the food was great! I ordered the regular platter with gyro. Next time I'll get the small I think. The hot sauce is freaking hot!!!!! Let this be a warning to you. It is not your average hot sauce. I used half of a packet and that was more than enough for me, it was soooo spicy and I can handle spicy pretty well. No wonder they only gave me 1 packet when I asked for the hot sauce on the side. The service was below average but I'll let that slide since they are brand new. They forgot my pita bread, which I didn't realize I was supposed to get until I heard someone else ask about it. The girl at the registered seemed to need a bit of help. But other than that I had a good dinner. Solid 4 stars. Wish there was better parking though, I parked behind the building and walked around front. Not sure if that's allowed?

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Regular gyro platter. Extra white sauce. Hot sauce on the side

HCTZpcBY2RoTHhzH5DytYA.text: I came here for the first time the other night and it was amazing. 5 star worthy. I loved my gyro from my first visit so much, that I came back again tonight for more. Unfortunately, my pita tonight was completely stale. Everything inside was delicious, but I wasn't able to enjoy it as much as I did during my first visit. I still believe in this restaurant because I tasted how wonderful they can be. Just give us some fresh pitas!

4XRfQncFQ_NRImeeBc84-w.text: BEST TASTING MEDITERRANEAN FOOD YET!   Surprisingly delicious! Good price (not great), friendly service, and great tasting lamb and dressings and sauce. Really nothing to complain about outside the price bring a tad high.

GKY3A3pBhx76_0OyoQ_bdQ.text: I think I was expecting something more from all the hype that was built up on this place. The portion was big, after taste left my mouth tasting of grease. I guess this is a good place to go after a bar since it is open late. Pet peeve of mine was that they ran out of forks. That's like running out of meat but still charging for it. If I come back again, I would order the gyro sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

yz8KE5B1-Ut1Jf9DiZnVJw.text: Amazing service with great food first time trying this delishness and has the combo bowl with beef,chicken, rice and veggies.  A great inexpensive lunch for me and Be careful with the hot sauce as it is super spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The combo bowl!

--VKuQqgujl3OpcmmJiLUA.text: Cool place, good food, and the staff was really nice! Thanks for staying open late and helping me when I'm craving a falafel!

XV9CPdUe6_j1FpDkhmH-ow.text: Halal Guys cart is always my to-go food whenever I visit New York. Now I moved here, I'm so happy that it opened their store in Tempe. Service is fast, small platter is nice portion for one (at least for me) and the white sauce is the best. I have eaten at least 3-4 times since their opening and I don't think I'm going to stop anytime soon. Chicken platter and combo platter are my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The chicken platter
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Halal Guys

duzRo973jlbuG_PqBv-PuQ.text: I don't get the hype :|  I've heard so many good things about Halal Guys; from long lines in Cali, TX, NY. When I heard little ol' AZ was getting one, I was more than ecstatic to try this place. I knew from the pictures what I was expecting, but maybe I was expecting to be blown away by the taste or something.   Yes, the servers were nice, fast, and helpful. But the food is another topic. I ordered the combo platter (chicken and gyro meat) with spicy sauce and extra white sauce. The platter was mostly rice and lettuce. I normally like my food saucy, but I now I understand why everyone said to order extra white sauce. The food seemed dry and a little plain. The white sauce helped a lot. I will say, the hot sauce is SOO spicy. When I first saw them sparingly drizzle red sauce over my platter I thought they just being cautious; NO, it was spicy. Thank goodness they didn't add more.   Overall, I think there are plenty of other better middle eastern food around town.   Environment: 4/5 Food: 2/5 Price: 3/5 Service: 4/5

a13TeucDs4IgvnurOFpGWg.text: Ordered the combo platter and had it delivered by UberEATS. Granted I placed my order at 2:30 am (I work graveyards), the meat was cold, rice lacked flavor and I prefer to have more pita to eat the meat with. They also failed to provide silverware and napkins.  It's a no, from me.

UFuYHx9XeifTKo0R25uQrg.text: Menu is basic and easy - you go down the line as they put together a bowl . It's a ver healthy portion , like the size of a pie . White sauce is delicious as well as the bowl . You must love hot hot hot sauce to have it slathered on the bowl . If you're not sure ask for it on the side - it is hot ! Also ordered the hummus ..delicious !   They are a few tables inside and out . When I went it was constantly packed . It's open late too for those late night munchies . I'd definitely be back !   Staff was very nice and willing to explain the bowl,etc. if you are unfamiliar with this type of food .

-cWsSB6jBdZ4-UJBmXi8hg.text: So bland. Pita was stale too. This is obviously just another place in tempe that stays alive from college kids being ok with crap as long as its cheap. Dont come here if you want good food.

sKF8k8vPsLn9y5EvLRd2Bg.text: I've heard so much about this place, so it made me excited when I heard one was opening up here. But I was a little disappointed when this place didn't live up to the hype.  I ordered the regular chicken & gyro combo plate with extra white sauce & extra hot sauce. This plate comes with rice, diced tomatoes & chopped ice berg lettuce. Without the white sauce, this dish is really plain. The white sauce is what actually makes the dish taste good.   The hot sauce on the other hand gives a really good kick. A little goes a long way. I feel like everything was really bland. I had to kind of drench it in white & hot sauce just to make it taste good.

2kEEGxJAe6zx-PMWAU4nhA.text: Come here sorta often, probably too often, but I just can't seem to get enough of this place.  I have only ever had the gyro platter, or the combo chicken and gyro platter and they are STRAIGHT UP AWESOME!  I think they put a chemical in their hot sauce cause I can't seem to get enough of that either.  BTW, their hot sauce is no joke, it will hurt you if you're not careful.   Reason for 4 stars and not 5 is based on two reasons. The first and most important is that I drove 50 miles from home round trip to come here for takeout so my wife could try it, and once I got home and started eating, I found a big nasty gross pubic hair in my chow. I showed my wife and she confirmed this is what it was. It did put a bad taste in my mouth for awhile, and I don't think she'll ever come back. The second reason is because for there itty-bitty ketchup-sized sauce packets are like $0.61.  Overall one of my favorite places, even though it's a bit expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Did two lines today. Best idea EVER!

_RzVWjpmK0C8CvAeNglItw.text: My expectations were pretty low after reading the reviews here, but to my delight this place exceeded my expectations! To be sure, it's not gourmet food or the best dining experience of your life, but it's good hearty and healthy food. I disagree with others who said the meat was bland. I got the combo platter and I was wary of the chicken being bland, but I found it to have a nice flavor and it was NOT dry which was most important of all. Also the lettuce did not take up 1/2 my platter, it was 1/3 at most. I couldn't finish the entire platter in one meal so I feel that it's a fair amount of food for the price. I really liked the rice and the gyro meat.  I ordered from uber eats and my platter came with 2 huge white sauce packets and spicy sauce. It was more than enough white sauce, I didn't even use 1 whole packet and I felt like it was more than enough white sauce. FYI the white sauce is their version of a tangy mayo. That spicy sauce is no joke! But I liked it. 1 spicy sauce is waaayy more than enough for an entire platter. If you can eat more spicy sauce than that, my hat's off to you!   Overall I would definitely order from here again!  Oh, but pass on the baklava - it's not great.

BI-aRnK-a9KWGSYq6F6imQ.text: The Halal Guys is one of our favorite NYC stops.  Being from California, were excited to see this company expand into the West.  On short visit to Phoenix we stopped in to get the Halal we've come to love.  Short story: We got it.  We loved the food.  On a scale of 10, this place in Tempe is a solid 9 compared to the Manhattan Halal Guys.  I think there was less meat on my plate than the NY joints.  We didn't try the baklava or the falafels, but the gyro, chicken, rice, and french fries were perfectly prepared.  The white sauce is what makes the dish, don't skip it.  I got two rows of hot sauce but could have used a third.  I love it.   I have to mention my interactions with the manager. Nidal is amazing.  This GM will take this restaurant to heights unknown.  After chatting a bit, it was clear that his mission is customer service.  His goal is to perfect this restaurant.  HALAL GUYS - Nidal is your guy!    On food alone, I would leave a strong 4 star review, but because of the management, it is a 5 star restaurant.  Wish I lived closer to enjoy more frequent visits.  Well done Halal Guys.

njaCxWWt6LCMrsNwPjx4ig.text: I am not drinking the same koolaid or "white sauce" that everyone else is. The tbl next to me put it best, This is not really worth $9-10 as I can get similar and even better food for less.  The falafel itself was crunchy and moist inside, however it lacked the flavor punch I am used to. The rice was fine nothing special same for the iceburg lettuce and tomato "salad"  a few soft peta points and that is a platter. They offer two sauces, White some may like dressing, and hot which truly is hot. However no tahini.  Sure it may have been on TV but you cant state what you see on tv.

JDaNt_aTgYdT_hEfEzhs5w.text: Absolutely an advertising business ! The rice is full of colors, I asked a person working there do you guys use color, they said no! I can believe it is the real deal I eat Middle Eastern food everyday such as at the Tasty Kobob, YOS restaurant, Shawrma Paradise, Moroccan Paradise, and the good is soo much better and genuine, I used to love the Istanbul Cafe the food was way better and genuine compared to the fake colored food at Halal guys, unfortunately Istanbul Cafe has been closed for such a long time.   I think this restaurant is overly biased I am not arguing about the price it's not overly expensive however I feel like street food in Pennsylvania, New York, Washington Seattle, even Texas and Illinois Chicago is better than this !   I feel like they need to improve the rice and the meat, generating flavor with sauces is just like tricking people! However the Falafel is good !

e6E6baRs9_fdfUKA16lNow.text: This place was pretty average. I ordered the beef gyro platter. It was a decent amount of food for around $10, but nothing about it really stood out. I have had more flavorful gyro meat at other fast dining places, such as Hummus Xpress. The white sauce was also nothing special. The pita triangles were served cold. I'm not sure if that's how they regularly come here, but pitas should be warm.  The staff was friendly and seemed to be trained well. I also appreciate that when they say "hot sauce," they mean it. I usually scoff at people who say that their restaurant's sauce is really hot, and I'm usually right (I've done the Blazin' Challenge twice). This time, I decided to take their advice and just put a little on the side. I'm glad I did. Respect to them for providing a serious hot sauce!

gusQdg5xXJvvrxS8YFsRiQ.text: So, just like everyone else I have heard how delicious this place was so I was pretty excited to try it! My boyfriend and I went to lunch here the other day and I got the regular sized platter with chicken, my boyfriend got the regular sized platter with the beef. The chicken was very flavorful, the rice was....eh.  I tried the beef and it was OK. The regular sized platter was more than enough food for me because I didn't finish it (because I was full). The white sauce is really good!  Was it as great as everyone made it out to be? No, not even close. Would I go there again? Yes, if my boyfriend wanted to go, but it wouldn't be my first choice by any means.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The white sauce is delicious!

1oFcLEwmhiNJMryIfcbotw.text: Finally, The Halal Guys are here in AZ.  This place has just opened across from ASU.  It's def tasty and the staff are super friendly.   Def come and check this out.  The hot sauce is super spicy but addicting.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The combo regular plate.   Very filling and tasty.

6f_dmr9LsYAOdJ4pa1w-XA.text: One of our favorite spots! Originally located on 56th & 6th in the heart of Manhattan-its all about the WHITE SAUCE! Get extra, you're welcome.   Always consistently yummy! The yellow/orange rice is delicious. I skip the veggies because it is just lettuce and tomato. Some people like it, though. They have platters in two sizes. You can also get a combo. I love the falafel and chicken. Again, extra white sauce! It's cheap and the service is fast as well-extra bonuses.   If you give them a 5 star   review, you get free fries and a drink! Whoo!!   P.S. We stood in line on opening night for 45 min and met the owner the night before when my Nee Yorker bf "had to have it" and he is a super nice guy!   Awesome place! Awesome food! Awesome people!  5 stars in my opinion

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheap and yummy! Open till 4AM

cFPR6FWpd1EwoPMwWk7bbg.text: Being from NJ and working in NY for over 3 years these carts were My go to lunch spot. When I heard they were opening a restaurant here I got super excited and could not wait. I tried to go to the opening day but the line was literally wrapped around the building.   So I decided to give it a few weeks and finally went yesterday night. There was still a slight line but primarily to Monitor the crowd almost like a club with a bouncer and he also gave a good description of the food and what to expect for the newbies. The line moved quickly though and so did the food line. Which again reminded me of the fast paced NY I miss.   The food did not disappoint at all!!! I ordered the Combo plate with chicken and gyro (pronounced Euro!!!) with the white sauce and 4 lines of the hot sauce. And trust me it was exactly like back home. The spice of the Hot sauce is not For the weak hearted but for me it was perfect and well worth the wait. So happy to have a piece of home in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sooooo good

uLUefP-0pMWNG6NBUDpJZw.text: We went to Halal Guys for dinner last night and I was very disappointed.   We were really excited to try it out since there has been so much hype leading up to their opening. Also, as a Middle Eastern food lover, I was excited for a new concept to come to the valley. However, I'm not sure that you could really call this Middle Eastern or Mediterranean food.  They only have two options on their menu: a pita wrap/sandwich, or a platter. Then you have your choice of meat: chicken, gyro, or falafel.  I ordered the platter which automatically comes with shredded iceberg lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and yellow rice. Then they top that with the meat(s) of your choice and a few slices of pita. They serve average pita like the type you could get at the grocery store. Their sauce options include white sauce, which is a mayo-based sauce, spicy sauce, or tahini, although you have to specifically request tahini.   Their food is extremely bland, and it is severely lacking something fresh - which may sound strange because half of my plate was shredded lettuce, but it lacks some type of vinegar - whether it's pickles, olives, or some type of dressing. Also, their hot sauce is so spicy that you can't even enjoy it, I'm not sure why they bother making it. It would be nice if they had a few different types of hot sauce, maybe something along the lines of a mild herb-based sauce, a medium sauce, and then their extraordinarily hot sauce.   All in all, I won't be back. I'd rather go elsewhere and spend less for more flavor and more authentic food.

fN80TVmtrjHA0THV12vA0g.text: The staff and Vanessa the manager were so friendly and welcoming. This is my first time here so they explained everything on the menu to me. The service was really quick and the food was delicious. The BBQ and white sauce combo was the bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. The combo plate with BBQ and white sauce!

rDWP3z-NHf4hzCPsQeRxuw.text: Only a little more than other Reviewers to contribute.  Yes, the "regular" Combo Plate (pictured) portion (mostly rice & iceberg) is large, the service was fast & friendly and they're open late, but other than that ... meh?  The very bright orange rice and chicken & gyro meats were a dry and the overall flavor (including that of the iceberg and diced tomatoes) was bland.  The "White Sauce" (pictured) did add some flavor.  By the admission of one female Employee, it's very similar (but more liquid-y) to mayonnaise.  Personally, I'm not a big fan of mayo on gyro meat, rice or salad fixings.  I also ordered French Fries (pictured).  Again, the portion size was large and they were served hot, but lacked ANY salt for flavor.  Had the male Employee who made them bothered to wash his hands after handling a broom (and possibly other cleaning chemicals / supplies), I may have been more comfortable eating them.  The price was a little on the high side.  The Combo Platter with French Fries (but no drink) plus tax was over $12.  This part of town (and others) has too much competition for Middle Eastern food to price it as such, especially considering the food quality and handling / sanitation concerns.  In sum, ok, but there is plenty of room for improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Back of &#34;White Sauce&#34; packet.  Per one employee, it&#39;s similar to mayonnaise.  Feel free to read the ingredients list for yourself.
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Front of &#34;White Sauce&#34; Packet
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. French Fries (freshly prepared, but without the Employee washing his hands after handling a broom).

Ec5Xjh9Sn4RrRIyEwTCQhw.text: Only our first experience at the H-Guys.  Super friendly guy greeted us... though we entered through the rear of the store.  He could tell we had not been before and brought us to the front where we could get a good look at the menu.  Today was not a big meal - falafels and baba ghanouj/ ganoosh... and baklava.  Really enjoyed all three items.  Fresh and tasty.  Because they don't have a huge menu, I think they can keep their eye on being good and consistent.  They even came and picked up our trays.  Maybe we look like food critics.... hahaha!   They have other locations, but we will probably return to this one in the near future for chicken and gyros.

Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

p3u-kNst-MfAlSNjtkHyug.text: Wow! A little taste of New York in AZ! How exciting! Yes, definitely went to the grand opening. Stood in the cold for an hour...was it worth it? Yes...and no...hmmm I got the small combo platter. The chicken was delicious but the gyro was average. The white sauce was good, but I don't get the hype? Idk? Hmm I'm definitely down to come back! Don't get me wrong it was a good experience...the food was good...but maybe it was just overhyped.   I like the freshness of the salad to cut the richness of the meal...but it's literally lettuce and diced tomatoes....   I would definitely come back because it's a good rice bowl to have. Can't wait to try with less wait.  The owners and the workers had great customer service.

Ee68zV32gRrzby2_Yr4JmA.text: The Halal Guys. What can I say? Wow. Went here for the grand opening festivities. They were giving out free Falafels for the people waiting in line while the employees came out and chatted with us. Overall, it was a pretty cool atmosphere. The food though. I've been to the original one in New York and the newer one that opened up in Los Angeles and I can see with certainty that this one is pretty much on point. Food was fresh and delicious, restaurant was clean and tidy, and the service was amazing. Oh yeah, speaking of service, the manager there (I believe she was the manager. If she isn't, promote her), Stephanie, is an amazing individual. She goes out of her way to take care of customers and make them happy.  10/10 would come again. FUEGO.

BIDEtf47m4_EDXzZ-oX3kQ.text: We were so excited to eat here, waited in line for about 30 minutes. It was so packed, so as soon as a table was free, we sat our kids down and proceeded to check out. As soon as we paid, the manager told us that we couldn't do that next time.  Table reservations are NOT ALLOWED!! Unfortunately, his comments ruined our appetite and became uncomfortable after being scolded for reserving our spot! Not worth it!

sKBWCkxBXozdIYbhurrHig.text: The food is delicious and the service is great. The staff are pleasant, helpful and very nice. I had the combo sandwich with lots of white sauce. Was amazing. Be careful though, the hot sauce is really hot. What a kick. You definitely can feel a very positive energy in this place. This is going to be my favorite spot from now on every time I'm in town.

UEDA8EZ1sAvq-WyM7JiSGg.text: AMAZING. I've heard great things from friends in NYC but I had to experience it myself. Well worth the wait. Hope they open one in Scottsdale.  Ps order the red sauce on the side. Extremely spicy.

4xXlH8PPz7ShGGBfnofG_A.text: I love going here, it's a great reminder of my New York travels, the flavor is very close to what I remember having in New York. The flavors on the beef are amazing, & the service is always amazing and friendly. I eat here at least once every two week & I've never had a bad experience here. I'm not sure where all these mediocre reviews tend to eat their food at but this is certainly worth the drive from my North Scottsdale location.

FNoqsOjo63i_Xf8I3UiJqg.text: Was excited because I moved here from New York and loved the original Halal Guys. Unhappy to report that it's not the same.  Firstly they give you far less meat than they do in New York. Charge me more if you need to but don't be stingy.   Then they ask for extra money for a packet of hot sauce while allowing you to help yourself to as much hot sauce as you want from a bottle.   Franchise businesses are not for everyone.

igDyJ1Ql_5ALI8o1LnISfw.text: Very cool cafe style Mediterranean. The chicken and gyro were both very good and the rice was awesome. Load up on garlic sauce, it's super good.

kNU_FWOjos_G88fxfwfQ7w.text: Hands down the best gyro I've had in Arizona. Make sure to get the white sauce on it! So good

r2IO_huEzRbT5CZwl2iDYw.text: Very fast and was delicious. Food was great and fresh. Employees were very friendly as well.

HmhQmh9M0TROsS4WRn099Q.text: After all of the hype, I went in with high expectations. Sadly, I walked away disappointed. The food was bland. The special white sauce was not special at all. The service was good, quick and friendly, but that didn't make up for the lackluster food. Bummer.

Y0Zck1ENkwcfi4fip0lFrw.text: Best gyro platter I'm town! From NY and I've been to halal guys many many times. Same great taste n so happy they are here! Easy on the red sauce cuz it's really hot. Been there 5x since they opened just a few weeks ago. Thinking bout their food is making me crave it right now! Go get you some too!

CiFL3CgY-7rsfswCiPYhgA.text: Reminds me exactly of the carts in midtown... Overall amazing, great food!!! Staff is always nice and accommodating! Truly go here like 2/3 times a week... Guilty! Reminds me of being on the East Coast

TYUSZfoQeY3J6_O9EpdC_A.text: Not worth the money. One of the most tasteless gyro wraps I have ever eaten. The meat was dry and there was way more lettuce than there should have been. Lastly, their white sauce is nothing special.

Tuk4A3WHKfDvd1ks8xfGEw.text: I've had the halal NYC experience and these guys are a disgrace! They not only skimp on chicken and rice but "fill up" the box with an unreal amount of salad - we're not paying for lettuce and tomatoes buddy! Secondly, they are rude and think way too much of themselves! Clearly not coming back here and sticking to my earlier choices in tempe!

S_JYIRMFr26MAab1tXPEIQ.text: I could never find time to stop by and try the food when in NY. I was excited to see the Halal Guys open in Tempe. We ordered a Gyro plate and a chicken plate with the famous white sauce. Loved the food and our plates were generously filled. Good Halal food is always a great find!

2Qxa6OAQZGKzxmXCnAVEqA.text: Very disappointed bad food this is not a middle eastern food I'm not going back again

_qC--wWXIFojQMlJNyFoTw.text: Went there opening day, it smelled good from the outside while we were waiting. Getting in was disappointing because the only options were tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, chicken, gyro, and rice with a small assortment of sauces. I have allergies so I couldn't have their white sauce and got hummus instead, which they didnt tell me was extra! The food was overall bland and just a small amount of the hot sauce made the dish almost inedible. I'd rather go to Hummus Xpress where they give you an entire pita with your bowl, not three measly cut up pieces

k0FfJO8thx6o4I-2Arjj_A.text: Small menu, but everything on it looks delicious.  This place recently opened and seems to maintain a daily crowd quite well.  Their food is good and reasonably priced.  I tried the combo platter with white sauce and enjoyed it.  I love spicy sauces/foods, but I don't recommend their hot sauce unless you can really handle heat though!

YoKLysONIq5t-7x1Reuaiw.text: Sooooooo good! The staff is very friendly and quick!! Love it and I will definitely be eating here regularly!!

1tL1f-oweTK-oRaQ1FaOcA.text: Nothing authentic middle eastern food. Falafal was rock hard and found a hair in my platter

JlnWRevbOG_5lzqm2N6IWQ.text: Ordered from uber eats. Forgot part of my order. Falafel is dry. Combo plate is also dry. The sauce that comes with the falafel tastes like tahini, but with garlic. Will never order from here again.

J3FN3FNymVmDxE8K4q3yWw.text: Service has always been good Food quality is the same as NYC but the quantity is less and it has increased in cost with more popularity. I like that it's close but don't necessarily have cravings for it anymore.   Mediterranean style chicken, rice, lettuce and tomatoes with small pieces of pita.  Addicting white sauce and really spicy hot sauce which has a thick paste like consistency.   Not something I would go to often, too many other places to go nowadays. But like I said great service and reminds me of being in college again!

skNvP5oaiGpd4HNikv2RJQ.text: Idk why it has 3.5 stars, this place satisfies man. Been a fan of the halal guys since I tried it in NYC back in 2012

zE0ghLfU5_CZ7igdMNfO9A.text: I was pretty disappointed in this place after getting excited about it from all the hype. i ordered a beef gyro platter. The meat was incredibly greasy, and the "White Sauce" they give you in a package on the side was disgusting (so, so rich). It did nothing to detract from the greasy meat like a typical cool, cucumbery Tzatziki should. They give you one little piece of pita with the giant portion of rice and meat topping. After that was gone, it was impossible to finish that oily disgusting mess. Rice wasn't too bad but the meat was supposed to be the star of the show. They get two stars because the service is fast & friendly but the food is absolutely terrible.

S5SgDPWqmOvF7O_Gn2k1sA.text: Maybe it's my fault but I was expecting a lot more than that. The rice was crunchy and the meal was nothing to brag about. Simple concept and friendly staff is what's getting them 3 stars.

gMt2YITXZB7gAWzLP4yLnw.text: Very mediocre food at unreasonable prices. One would presume that a restaurant so close to the university would have better food with more affordable pricing but this is just not it. Moreover, they're very stingy with the food.

_ZFNNKJJ_g1aJTsiCGWMwg.text: Good food, pretty average. Didn't knock my socks off. Only thing is that it's very convenient

5XiEZeWjUQeHmxuJ_iWf0A.text: This place is worth a visit. Was kind of skeptical about trying it since most of the reviews said it was bland. The only thing simple are the basic lettuce and tomatoes but you need that pop of freshness. The beef and chicken was flavorful even by itself. The white sauce was really good, can't get enough of it so there's 1 bottle by drink station. The hot sauce it very pica ! It's a whole other kind of heat the more you eat the hotter it seemed to get so only get a few lines when ordering or packets on the side. Overall, I like this place a lot but its probably  more fun buying their food off of a food truck in New York like my mother in law did when she first had them.

X9XoRliqkIBPCsCt3zVYyA.text: I don't understand the few poor reviews. This place is fantastic as the long lines would indicate. Everything is fresh and delicious. Especially the pita bread. I had the falafel plate and it was the best falafel I have ever had in AZ. The service was great too.

jkGlkIy35NVTsRPVR6QXdQ.text: Just went earlier today, it's my second time eating here and I like it. Really tasty and the white sauce is delicious.  I did have to wait in line for a while even though there was only 1 person in front of me. There were 4 people behind the counter. Aside from waiting, I'll keep coming back for more.

lflT7bdfQA3fz3GLIlTOKw.text: This place is my go to restaurant at least once a month. Always love the food. It reminds me when I was in New York.

q0X10KjiBOYpDC8G776nRA.text: Avoid this place. Food over priced and rewards program a joke. Got run around with rewards program and they are just too greedy and don't care to help, spoke to and emailed them.  I already cut up my rewards card and encourage everyone to do the same, I will never go here again, these people are very greedy and don't care.

XgEUYSioWxmcnvUj_p-Sfg.text: Upon entering the store we weren't greeted or acknowledged. Ordering was a bit confusing and the worker wasn't much help. Although the veggies in my sandwich were very yummy and fresh, the chicken was WAY too dry and over cooked and ruined it for me. Unfortunately will not be returning to try anything else.

eSfv0IA6s2AjQWU75uK-Pw.text: Like many others pointed out, the service is great, nothing at all wrong on that end. Now the food... All you get is your meat which is honestly sub par at best and you get rice and salad which is just a handful of lettuce... They give you an option for hot sauce and white sauce. The hot sauce is the only good thing they have going for them because I love spicy food and the hot sauce here is comparable to the Buffalo Wild Wings blazing sauce, perhaps even Hotter. Too bad the food here isn't worth it. The white sauce is some kind of mayo dressing that's loaded with fat. Literally not kidding, one packet of white sauce dressing has 33grams of fat! If you're watching your macros skip the white sauce, I see that many people enjoy it and drench their bowls with it, but I wonder if they know the facts. Anyways as far as improvements, if they want to compete with real Mediterranean joints then I suggest making veggie options and better overall quality food. For the price I'll stick to Hummus Xpress on Hardy & University, as they give you much better flavourful food which includes: real salad, very good humus, better meat, and hot veggies (Fried eggplant, glazed carrots,Lemon pepper broccoli etc.), not just lettuce, and a variety of toppings you can add for free.

gLDyJkaAm11Tl1iMYuv_BA.text: I'd actually give it a 3.5 but I'll round up... the costumer service is really good and the staff is nice and helpful. The place is decorated nicely as well. As well as the food goes... I have definitely had better gyros and shawarmas around the area. The food is okay, nothing too special. I really wish the sauce was better since for me that makes or breaks the wraps and I find it really lacks flavor.  I will be back here though  just because there are not lots of Halal places near ASU.

sEIkat50q9NXAJTfsRX3pA.text: Really good! The gyro is better than the chicken IMO. Also less is more with the hot sauce so be careful lol.

fLeHpnKHfAqT5LYX67TdkA.text: This place is BOMB. I had the combo sandwhich and could not put it down. Seriously so tender and sooo good. This is a must go and you will not be disappointed. I will be back soon.

eSU9bByeKUMdX2Gldp4Tqg.text: Pretty good. One of the better I have tasted in the Tempe area. Not quite up to par with flaming kabob, Phoenicia or hummus Express but I imagine it's good drunk college food at 2 am.

FeickOT8cy5zFDOe4gfUzA.text: I ordered the combo plate with chicken, gyro, tomatoes, lettuce, rice, and white sauce. I definitely was not impressed. The meat tasted really bland and was lacking a lot of flavor. I don't know what the big hype was all about. The service was amazing but I didn't come for service. I came to try the food. I was extremely disappointed. I wouldn't recommend to anyone. Stick to Haji Baba or Wessen's Intl Kitchen if in the Tempe area. Trust me.

TrsKYiZHOWShousyciGT4g.text: Went their on opening day and with this long line, they managed to serve everyone really fast. Food was awesome and everything was to perfection. I would definitely recommend this spot.

JOixm0o7xPKUTaKH4mjyNQ.text: Food with fresh and tasty. I'd compare it to a Chipotle or a Fired Pie of the Mediterranean. Fresh meats and good sides. Friendly attentive staff. They also have falafel and their sauces are very tasty.

OI-fJjI8MRQL9_GuZDjKlA.text: I have heard a lot about this place from many people and we wanted to give it a try. After evening show at the movies, we landed up going to this place for dinner around 10:30.   The place looks like any fast food chain, we ordered chicken platter. The rice they add is really good and thats the only thing which i liked. The chicken was too bland and didn't find it fresh. My bowl was filled with lettuce . The sauce was good but its like any other Mediterranean sauce.   I was not impressed and did not like the food, does not look like any picture or video that ran on television in the restaurant. Price is reasonable

BWblAo8O7o1Sd0rCzcwGqg.text: So simple, so easy to order, so delicious. Those red and white sauces are cracktastic. It is good food fast so don't go in there expecting fine dining like some of these people writing reviews. The guys working there are courteous. They fry those french fries up on demand and I LOVE some good hot crinkle cut fries.

fzvQUOp4gXWJNpzgDrSf-Q.text: There's only so much rice and chicken that I can actually eat, until I get sick of it.   I was super excited about going to Halal Guys! I've heard about this chain based off in New York and how people were raving about how good the chicken and rice combo is. When I got there, it was clean and kinda set up like a fusion between Chipotle and Five Guys.   I got the Large chicken and gyro combo and they definitely give you pretty reasonable portions here! You are able to choose some additional condiments to add to your rice plate, as well as if you want to add a sauce to it. Of course they recommended to add the white sauce, which is a fusion between a plain yogurt and ranch dressing.   The plate I got was good. There wasn't anything to "rave" about when it came to their chicken though. You can seriously get some more flavorful chicken at places like let's say Panda Express of Yogi Grill. The basmati rice was good, however by itself is a little bland. That's what the sauce is for.   Overall, I'm most likely not gonna come back here for awhile. Service was excellent, however the kind of Mediterranean/Greek influenced style food was alright. I feel I can get better tastes of gyros and stuff at actual Greek restaurants etc. But then again, maybe I just don't crave this kind of food!  Tips 1) Dont get too much of that red hot sauce!!!! It's super spicy! You will suffer if you put too much on your rice 2) get a normal rice plate, should definitely be enough to fill you up

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rice combo with chicken and gyro. Layered with the white sauce

4Z_5eJfEQ-CBY7kVbTGY0w.text: Finally had the opportunity to eat at Halal Guys.  Ordered the Beef Gyro and Chicken Platter, Chicken Gyro Sandwich and Beef Gyro Sandwich along with the Falafel. Both the Beef and Chicken are pretty good and we selected the white sauce over the meats. I am more a beef gyro person, but the chicken was also good and juicy considering it was mainly white meat and I prefer dark meat.  The combo platter comes in two sizes and includes a salad with slices of pita.   Could really do without the Falafel which is a deep fried ball of peas.  The menu is simple and the counter is quick with prices geared more for lunch style prices.   This restaurant was very hiped up coming to Tempe next to ASU and is in a nice small strip mall just North of the Dutch Bros. The good thing is the strip mall has not only Halal Guys but Even Stevens Sandwich Shop and Ahipoki getting ready to open soon.  Will definitely be back when I am around ASU.

h3UmDyIYx4BMvA6FuF3WVw.text: Dry chicken sandwich. Dry pita bread. Hot sauce tastes like it should be on a burrito not a gyro place.  sandwich was $8 fries were another $3. Bland and gross. The Tahini served with the Falafel was also extremely flavorless. Who rates this place 5stars? World famous? Horrible.

f4Nam0TJ6fKyh9Dt0229Ow.text: We had tried out the free samples at the Halloween Yelp bash and finally were in the area so we decided to try more. It was easy to find. Parking was a bit werid and when we stepped out of our vehicle we were hit with the smell of weed from the apartments behind but we still ventured forward. The building was very clean and surprisingly empty for the time we were there. My daughter loved that she could customize her Gyro. My partner ordered the platter and that was plenty to share with our toddler son. We also ordered extra pitas and they were amazing. The only thing that was just okay was the hummus, the rest was da bomb. I can't wait to go back and fill up again!

joaJ1PkzM0JVradr593Rlg.text: I have limited words for what just occurred!! Came in in a  rush between meetings, the woman working was super kind and great. They were out of gyro but post lunch so whatever. After I got my food, I was told there were forks by the exit. Went to grab a fork and there were none. No one was up front so I walked to where I could be seen, but no one. I said excuse me three times, and no one responded. So I went and grabbed a prepackaged fork set from near the register. Then I attempted to leave and was verbally yelled at by one of the workers for going in back. I explained that I had waited for them, called for them, and was in a rush and needed a fork!!! Just a fork! And proceeded to be verbally accosted for doing so. The guy had gauges and was in his 20s, wearing a black hat. Still cannot believe I was screamed at for grabbing a fork when they were completely out on the floor. Like what.

S-kx-yVuM499Z75e_S0xZQ.text: How could I not go here after missing my guys on the streets of NYC!? While this environment is more quiet and sterile, it still brings me back to NY, taking my hot combo meal and eating in Central Park, tossing pitas to the pigeons. People out here don't understand this type of NY street food but it will grow on you. Been there three times and will be back every once in awhile for the memories of NY and my Halal guys, oh and girls here....staff is super nice and sauce is SUPER HOT so don't go in there asking them to drown it and then whine that the sauce is too hot. You can get it on the side.

toJWtpNsIIc1GRw3LdIFqA.text: I came here for the first time with my husband when I was pregnant and we've been going back at least once a month ever since!  I started out with trying their combo plate of chicken and gyro but the chicken was a bit too dry for me. It tasted great with EXTRA EXTRA white sauce, but I can't begin to imagine how many calories are in it, so I choose to stick with just 1 Extra White sauce and all gyro. Granted the calories in the whole meal is going to be astronomical, I got to find a way to cut small corners, right?  The staff is always great but can be a bit slow at times. However I can't complain because I can only imagine what the wait is for the original halal guys in NYC.

TExQYPMk0cFm7F1VTwbR9A.text: This franchise of a staple of the east coast classic really fell flat for me. I found that it had all of the aesthetic yet somehow none of the soul. Over fried falafel, dry gyro and unrealistically hot sauce. You're better off finding something local and authentic.

g0XGH98bDvl3JCunSxrR7g.text: Watch out for the red sauce! It's like surface of the sun hot! It has an amazing flavor but it'll literally set your insides on fire.  I went here in between Uber rides as I do a lot of Uber Eats pickups from this spot and I love Mediterranean food. Upon walking in, I noticed that you can either order a platter or a pita wrap. In an effort to maintain my hourglass figure, I went for the platter without rice (too many carbs and it's cooked in chicken stock). Basically I ended up with three or four falafels on top of a bed of shredded lettuce with some pita wedges. The falafels aren't made in house...they come in frozen in a big bag and then are dropped in the frier. They taste just ok.   The staff that works here is awesome...so friendly and helpful. They asked if I wanted tahini on top of the falafel, which is awesome...and then they cautioned me about the red sauce. I feel a proper expectation was set for how hot that stuff is.   I think next time I'll try a wrap because there are other things you can add to it such as olives, cucumbers, etc.

Z1xsnNWgSiq9NCLaK5YS4Q.text: I ordered 5 platters through Postmates and I live about 20 miles away so it's definitely not across the street. The postmates driver came on time but only brought 4 platters. Upon finding out that we only got four platters instead of 5, the postmates driver immediately called the halal guys store and spoke to the owner named Logan to let him know of the situation. The owner went beyond and took responsibility for the mistake and tried to get us the missing platter but unfortunately there were no postmates drivers showing in our area at this point, being that it was 2am.  The owner of halal guys in Tempe then told us that he feels really bad and drove all the way from Tempe to the east valley, about 20 miles, and delivered us the missing platter at 2:30am! That's True dedication and exceptional customer service, this owner truly cares about his business and his customers!

40uM-9Sr206r8v7ApQZHDA.text: My fiancee introduced me to Halal guys when we visited New York City and I immediately fell in love. We were both excited when we found that there were locations in the Phoenix area. It's no frills food, and that's what we love about it. I also do the combo plate, with white sauce and a little bit of the hot sauce. Be careful with that hot sauce, that shit is hot!!!! This location delivers through Ubereats to my work, which is always a nice lunch when I'm craving it. Sometimes at the restaurant the service can be so so, depending on the time you go.

wNyozkdpXqFLn_joWB3Cuw.text: Food is great... GET MORE PEOPLE WORKING THE LINE AT NIGHT... the line can get ridiculous and I have walked away multiple times because of how long it takes the single person working the line to get through all the orders  Portion sizes have drastically declined. Not sure I will be returning. Will wait until I'm back in NYC

ZMdZkY-rS8XTCGGpkdY_yA.text: I used UberEats. I ordered the chicken and beef platter with no lettuce and no tomatoes, I added fries. And I asked them to go easy on the sauce. When I received my order I didn't have any fries, there was lettuce and tomatoes included, and they put extra sauce. I already had to wait 40 minutes for this order.  I called Uber eats, they processed me a refund, they told me that I could get a five dollar discount and that it would be available if I re-ordered immediately. So I did, re-ordered immediately. I waited another hour this time. And when my food came there was no sauce on the food, I still got lettuce and tomatoes instead of all rice. And I got my fries this time, but they taste like they're old, and I don't think fries are supposed to be chewy. Undercooked? It's kind of sad, because I was really looking forward to this place for months. I'm hoping they do something for me to compensate for this inconvenience.

I got the white sauce on top and put a little hot sauce on top.. the hot sauce was pretty hot and my mouth felt like it was on fire but it was still good..

The house sauce is really good but I would ask them to go light.  Platters also looked really good and fairly priced.  Will definitely go back!
