dPlRuA4PEj8YrVrvlEnOqQ.text: I was very disappointed with my visit.   Meats are essentially flavorless.  Pita is dry and stale.   And I am not sure I have ever been to a Mediterranean place that does not have actual tzatziki sauce.   They serve some type of crappy mayo based substitute.  This was my first and last time at this place.

R-p3r__rNHTQa3LHlHoqZw.text: 10/10 would recommend to a friend. Amazing service and good quality food. I can't wait to go back!

cqc21crh5D-qnrWjCTA3bA.text: The food was all right, but they don't have tzatziki. That's unforgivable and genuinely going to keep me from coming here ever again. What kind of lame gyro place doesn't have tzatziki? Nobody wants your disgusting mayonnaise, Halal Guys.

mtw9GcBI6n1xF8NI6hfVTA.text: I'm sick and tired of reading reviews on YELP where entitled people want to go on about delivery service, a rude waiter, a hurried hostess or something that has to do with service. They don't give but 1 star (Less if they could) to service alone. When will yelp break their rating system down? All I give a shit about is the food! The flavor of it, the preparation. Humans are entitled to bad days that will pass. However the shitty rating lives in forever!! Ok, enough about my rant. The food is great. I'm a New Yorker and have been loving Halal Guys on 59th since I was little. This place is great....not quite as good as NYC carts, but it's good enough. Better than you'll find anywhere on the left coast!! Gyro with extra white and light red!!!!! All day. So glad they're here in AZ!!!!!!

DWr8AJOcJzz_-B0K2ywxSg.text: I really wanted to like this location after going to the original location in NY on 53rd & 6th Ave but the food was not quite what I remembered. It's been over 6 years since I had food from the street cart over there but it seems like the portions here are smaller than what I remember and the chicken meat was more dry than I expected. I still had a great meal though but unfortunately it doesn't compare to the NY location.  Still plan on giving this place another visit because I really like the food and especially the white sauce!

zp3pLg0EReS9Ua0yE69Akg.text: Edit: I now know why they do this - they are slammed! It wouldn't be fair to take an online order that would trump the long line of people out on the sidewalk! The GM, Nidal, was so helpful and let me know that they do offer Uber Eats, Yelp 24, Postmates and Door Dash.   Food was fresh and my clients (I ordered for 12 people) were absolutely thrilled.   I WILL BE BACK!   First review: Two Stars- I am trying to get food from here but they don't allow you to order online or over the phone. You can either come in or use another ordering site. Seems crazy. Hopefully the food is worth the effort.

iZLzyB4n7M_3QtmMOQ2sEw.text: Okay so   Food was 3/5 Its good but not in any definition special, but then again they market it based on their legendary popular name so that gets our hopes up, no? So, don't be afraid to give it a try. It's quite decent except for the pita/flat bread thingy smells like plastic and a tad too soggy, but that's minor considering this is a fast food place.  Food portion 3/5  They need to balance out the amount of lettuce n rice, mine didn't come with nearly enough rice.  Service 4/5  Quick n courteous, just need to be a bit more clear of the procedure in the sauce section.  Packaging 0/5 My lid was loose ( I told them Togo) so use your best imagination to picture my lunch.  Price: Not cheap, but Arizona experience 25% minimum wage increase in January 2017, not their fault.   So I probably need to comeback in a few months to give them another try once they work on the kinks.

T1QZVP4yw_6VPPPvxT8bmw.text: I give this place one star. I would give it less but they did at least manage to open a restaurant and serve food. We had heard all the hype about this place "finally coming to town" so we were looking forward to trying it. We did order it through uber eats so I can't comment on service, atmosphere, or staff friendliness. I will say the order was correct and warm when it arrived so that's a plus. That's it for the pluses. Everything went downhill from there. I would describe the food as bland and flavorless. We ordered some chicken platters and some gyros. The platters were almost all lettuce not much chicken. The rest of the veggies looked sort of sad and colorless. The white sauce was fine. Not flavorful but not terrible. Just sort of there. I put in on my food to try and improve the experience. If it did nothing for flavor, at least it gave me the activity of tearing open the packets to squeeze out the product and take my mind off the food I was eating. Just packets of sauce. Nothing fancy there.   The hot sauce? HOT. Silly hot. Not enjoyable hot. I will tell you I am not a huge fan of hot sauces in general, especially not the painful ones so maybe it's not fair for me to weigh in on it but I did. I tried to add the hot sauce to the flavorless food to help it but all it did was anger me.   I ate the food because I was hungry and it did provide sustenance but that's it. We will not waste time with this again when there are dozens of other local places and even more chains and fast dining establishments.   Check it out if you need Late night food but I wouldn't waste your time, money, or energy.

xp719NKYQj2IplI3rPm8UA.text: I, like probably many others, was really excited to try out this place. But oh boy what was I disappointed. I had read all the great reviews about this place and was expecting the food to taste like I had tasted it in some countries around the Mediterranean Sea. It was like one reviewer described very BLAND. Nothing worth to make the trip back to this place. There are several places in Tempe that have the same kind of food which come closer to the taste profile of how this kind of food should taste.   However two positive things that are an important part of the whole dining experience is the level of customer service and the cleanliness of the place. This place excelled in both. That's why I gave them 2 stars. Unfortunately the food makes up the greatest part of giving them 3 less stars than what they could have gotten......

j-9xuHPs-Wj-Za7_aw__nw.text: Yummy food, great atmosphere. Wonderful staff and managers, they know how to make customers happy. Even when its busy, the whole crew has a smile on there face! I'd recommend this to everyone!

uG-_K22eXJ12rpT0L6el0g.text: Food is typically good. I came here a few times before but yesterday was just a bad experience. We ordered plates and sandwiches. Sandwiches barely had any meat. I complained to the gentleman that prepared my food and told me it would be an extra $3.50 for extra meat. I had to show him my sandwich for him to give me extra meat without paying. He didn't even apologize. It looked like a salad sandwich. The meat was dry and overcooked. On top of a poor sandwich, the customer service was not good. I don't think I will ever go back.

j4QHIRu4n3M4FasAkod-Fw.text: Love this place. Fast service, good choices and great food. Has many vegetarian options and at the same time it doesn't burn a hole in your pocket. Tried the falafel platter, hummus with pita and the falafel sandwich with fries. The spicy red sauce is the icing on the cake

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Falafel platter with hummus and pita!

ac1FySIIofPuIsRW6Xzn_g.text: The service was on par with the original. I can't say for sure but the platter seemed to be a little smaller than the one in New York but the taste was just the same. I'm guessing they are justifing the cost increase because of the restaurant set up rather than a stall. All in all amazing experience and also comes with the extra long lines..:p just like in NYC!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

jEK60ODOgBuhVeDqAbcr6g.text: Best food  love them so excited, reminds me of my east coast. Best Arabic food in AZ.  The employees are so nice and service was fast !

1v33YTFWiK5NLaInY-D5RA.text: Out of gyro at 10:10... unacceptable. I wanted a combo not just chicken and falafel is not an ok substitute for gyro... being that it is not meat.   Employees breaking down the line as if they were closing yet you guys are open until 11.   I've been here like 15 times since you opened and this is not how it's been.   Almost as if the higher ups aren't around anymore and now it's just like any other fast food place where the workers and managers don't care and want to close early. Or... and more likely some higher up decided they could save money by not making more gyro an hour before they close in order to save money... well how much money are you saving when people leave and don't buy food, because there isn't any to sell?  1 star.

2NauLxU8sUcqDavXHDLkuw.text: I've been hearing great things about this place and finally they open one in Arizona! The set up in here is very quick. I asked the girl to explain the menu and how things works there and she seemed very helpful since I'm a new customer. But the food was not what I expected. I got the regular combo which has chicken and gyro over rice with four pieces of pita bread.   Honestly everything tasted so bland.. Chicken was dry, gyro was so oily, rice was hard and too bland. There was no special taste to the platter. I added the white sauce and that is basically what makes the platter taste very good, without it the dish is very plain and bland.   Kudos to them for opening very late and right next to a university. Service was nice and helpful. I would definitely be back to try other dishes but I wouldn't get the platter again. (:

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Small restaurant.
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Platter.

rDCjNm113-gGbNXmAM29tA.text: I really liked this place for a good lunch at a decent price near campus. It's within walking distance from ASU but I'm sure it gets crowded with students during peak times. We scored...it's spring break so lines were not long.  The menu is simple and ordering is easy. There was only one person prepping food. It would have been a bit faster had there been two people working the station, but no major complaint. The line stilled moved quickly.    I had the regular size falafel meal.  I could not finish it. The falafel was tasty as was the rice. The side salad was fresh and was delicious with their special white sauce. (The sauce was actually lightly poured on everything and I loved it.)  Their hot sauce is super spicy and tasty. It's hotter than sriracha so watch out. I got a slow burn in my tummy about 15 minutes later, but nothing that diet coke couldn't cure. Yup, it's that hot.   Seating is close together inside and kind of sparse outside. I wouldn't expect to get a table during prime times, so you may want to plan to get it to go.   Service was good--- friendly and efficient staff and the it's clean too. My only teeny tiny criticism is that the fork handles are short. I had to maneuver my fork in the bowl to get at the good bits. If my only complaint is short fork handles, you know this place is good! I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu.

d6Pe-hHoMQiaNKb-f5tc2w.text: I give The Halal Guys a lot of credit for opening directly across the street from ASU. Smart!  AND, they're open until 4 in the morning, on Thursday thru Saturday's. Real smart!  When I worked in the WTC in New York, there were a bunch of Middle Eastern food trucks on Broadway, near the old Merrill building at One Liberty.  There was always a Kabob truck, a Falafel truck and Gyro truck.  Oh yeah, and a Sabrett's Hot Dog stand. LOL   The Halal Guys were a midtown operation, but very similar.  "Halal meats that are seasoned to perfection and a melting pot of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean flavors that are sure to delight."  You should know, that Halal, Halaal, or  food is not the same as Greek food. It's middle eastern in origins, but tastes subtly different. You'll find no Kronos lamb spinning here either.   They serve their food steamed (photos), not fried -- on a plate with chicken or beef type gyro meat(photo), over rice and bed of iceberg lettuce, covered in their proprietary (creamy mayo) White Sauce.   We really liked our food. We ordered the combo plater of beef and chicken; with a sides four falafel balls with tahini sauce and a small bowl of humus. We also grabbed a beef gyro to go. LOL  The rice was very tasty and we found the meat to be slightly bland, but their sauce made up for it. If you enjoy heat, you'll have to try their chili paste based Hot Sauce. I loved it, a 8/10 alarm'er.   So Three Stars, "A-Okay".

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

JW_aDWQej7Jf6dLyIho5GA.text: Great to eat anytime of the day. Americanized mediterranean flavors with the choice of gyro, chicken, falafel on a bed of rice and lettuce. Options of hummus, falafel, or fries. They are known for their White Sauce, so don't forget to add some! If you're a fan of spicy try out their Hot Sauce, but forewarning it's the devils spit!  Make it hurt soo good!  Over all it's simple, great tasting, and fast.

EZ89p5K-HQvpFMtfbQo5fg.text: Thought this place was just called "Halal Guys", sans the article. I digress already. Came with a friend of mine who was also excited about their opening; she tried them in NYC and it was my first time. I arrived around noon and it was busy with a short line outside to regulate traffic inside the restaurant. Lots of employees working, making food preparation quick and efficient. I got the small falafel platter ($7.95) with white sauce and tahini and a packet of hot sauce on the side.   I snagged a table outside for us to sit and waited a few minutes as my friend got her food. The platter has your choice of protein and rice, lettuce, tomatoes and pita bread. My portion was a good size for me as I finished it in one sitting. After all the hype, it's hard not to get my expectations up but there they were, hanging out with the clouds. After trying them out, they were humbly lowered back down to earth. I didn't find my food to be anything spectacular; it was lacking sauce and the hot sauce was pure heat, no flavor. I'm glad I got tipped off to get it on the side. The bowl seemed like something I could easily replicate at home.   Food wasn't bad, but wasn't amazing either. I wouldn't not go again, but it isn't at the top of my list to go back soon. Good effort guys, and nice customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Falafel platter

Hbfr5gOVLXJTFE-E1US-Mw.text: 5 Star Service, 2.5 Star Food, 1 Star Baklava! Get Out Of Line And Save Your Money!  The service here is outstanding. All of the staff were friendly and welcoming!   The food was pretty bland.... I got the combo platter... the meat was decent but not much flavor... the spicy sauce is horrid with spice but no flavor....   The unbelievable part is that for the first time in my life baklava was not good! It tasted like cardboard and stale! I've never not enjoyed baklava, but I couldn't even finish my first piece, I threw piece the number 2 away.   Baklava is -1 star! Meal is 3 stars Service 5 stars Hot sauce is -1 stars  I don't imagine I will be coming back here again. I don't see what the hype was about at all.   There are better halal food sources in the area....   How can baklava be bad? But it is soooo bad!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. People are lined up!
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

rlgNi_Nj29QUBA7xbrk_5w.text: I am so glad this place stays open late for college students. They are open until 4am I believe on Fridays and Saturdays! That's almost unheard of in Arizona - sadly - unless you want whataburger or filiberto's. The staff are always extremely nice and helpful no matter how busy they get.   I always order the same thing: a regular chicken and gyro meat combo platter. Their white sauce is so addicting and I always get extra of it along with their red sauce. Whenever I ask for their red sauce they pause, look up and say "have you ever had our red sauce?" Because it's super hot to others lol; but I have a high tolerance for spiciness so it doesn't bother me. As for others I know, they cannot handle its spice level so I would say be cautious I guess.   Cons: i wish it didn't take an eternity to collect enough points towards a free platter. I feel they should give out more points per purchase. But you do get a free platter on your birthday! Also, I noticed they changed the type of chicken they use and I miss the old one which was shredded chicken and it might have been white meat? Now, they are dark meat chunks, but to be fair, the people I know prefer it the way it is now.   Again, it's so nice to have a different type of food option that is open late with such nice staff. Definitely try it out.

GAr0DbP1tjdGqSPN40Ih2Q.text: What a disappointment!  I came here after work, excited to try this place that I've been hearing about.   My hubby ordered me the combo platter which is chicken and beef. The meat didn't have any flavor at all. Half of the dish was lettuce and under the meat is rice.   Really this just tastes like generic fast food.  I am usually not too picky, but I couldn't even finish my food. THIS PLACE DID NOT LIVE UP TO THE HYPE!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baklava, smells like cardboard and tastes horrible!

11KxfOKjeJn5TwR-vRJfOg.text: This is a good place to go for Middle Eastern comfort food -- and plenty of it.  Service was fast, but there aren't a lot of tables.    The menu is pretty simple.  My son and I chose the chicken and gyro combo, which came with plenty of both.  The rice was very good, there was a small salad of lettuce and tomatoes, and the extras of onion, green peppers, and olives added a lot of flavor -- especially those olives.   On the sauces, unless someone is adventurous or likes things pretty spicy, I'd advise sticking to the white sauce.  It's a spiced up yogurt blend that I think of as Ranch Jr.  When the server asks if you want more, say yes because the usual portion isn't enough.    Two sizes are offered.  The large is only $1 more than the small and a lot bigger.  Both my son and I couldn't finish ours, so took them home for another meal.  I also bought a 2-piece box of baklava, thinking we could have it later.  But my son declined -- and yay! to that.  It was excellent.

3ToRcnlCUsCCBctIGkZ_Rg.text: I'm originally from NY so I was pretty excited to hear that Halal guys were opening a store close to where I lived. I went the day after it opened (around 5:30pm) and the lines were still out the door. It took abt ~20min to get from where we stood in line to ordering our food. An employee was handing out stickers.   There are apparently 2 sizes you can order if you get the platter. I ordered the large [~$9] combo platter, which is the equivalent to the NY one size only platter. Half of the platter consisted of iceberg lettuce and tomatoes and the other half was rice and meat, but more rice than meat. So, it was pretty disappointing for them to skimp out on food. Usually, lettuce is only supposed to fill 1/4 of the container. I heard from several friends that it seemed healthier (not in a good way) bc there wasn't a nice layer of oil covering the bottom once you ate the whole thing. The meat wasn't as flavorful - maybe the taste will improve in some weeks or so~  There were about 7 or 8 two-seater tables inside and ~2 four-seater tables outside. It was a battle to grab a table and then keep it - employees and customers alike gave us so much heat it felt pretty uncomfortable.   There's a parking lot! However, Dutch bros is right next to this food plaza and they currently have a one way drive through that some cars actually confused as another entrance into the halal guys' parking lot and you can imagine there were a lot of angry drivers and loud honking. So be careful that the parking lot entrance you're entering is the right one!   Overall, I'm glad I can indulge in halal food whnever I crave it, so I can't complain too much.

I7wFiu_XzXAfd4QWfDSt4Q.text: Definitely worth the wait. So excited that they are here in Arizona!   The line was long ( out to the streets) for their grand opening but it moved pretty quickly.   Pros: + fast and friendly + reasonably priced + the white sauceeeee yummmm   Cons: - the sandwich was messy and for almost the same price, it's better to stick with the plate since they over-do it with the lettuce in the sandwich  - the tomatoes were not the freshest  The hot sauce is definitely HOT so if you're not ready for the fire don't ask for extra hot sauce like I did haha

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken gyro
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo platter

_FXLZ0_QtlqcBIsnEDRn4A.text: I've been coming here for a couple years now and after tonight, I will never be coming back. Not to this location at least. I could not believe how the so called "manager" (could never tell by the way she conducted herself) spoke to a customer with such disrespect just because he brought his dog into the restaurant. Not to mention the stench of Marijuana smoke coming from the employees. And to think you guys touch my food.   If I could give this place 0 stars I would after my experience tonight. You guys used to offer a clean and healthy eating option for me and my friends. Now, it's just trashy and nasty. Who makes the hiring decisions here? Geez

2oQ5pefXVU8JLHigDzLUsQ.text: Trying this restaurant for the first time.  The halal chicken is imported from Minnesota. The halal gyro beaf is imported from New York. This chicken sandwich is delicious. Always put the white secret sauce in your meal.  The staff are really nice and they do a great job. Worth trying. Worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Opening menu

016Fz8UUXEXm_WHzt73gBQ.text: I was pretty excited to try Halal Guys . We went for an early dinner so the line wasn't to bad and even when their was a line, it moved fairly quickly. The menu is pretty simple. Either order a gyro or a platter. I opted to try the chicken and gyro platter which came with rice, lettuce, tomatoes, pita bread and the two meats. Definitely get the white sauce and it you like spicy , try the red sauce too. I usually like my food spicy so I got some more red sauce on the side. My mouth was on fire  and I regretted putting more red sauce in my food.  I thought the meats had good flavor (esp the beef) And the price was reasonable. I liked that it was fast and quick and I enjoyed my meal :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken and gyro combo

jFbZF6CsU4gFp7StmHxdUA.text: Ooo, a taste of New York in Tempe (also known as the barren wasteland for foodies... I came straight from a short stint in LA so I am a little bit spoiled) and OPEN LATE!  I got the falafel platter and loaded it up on the white and hot sauce. The boy serving me seemed incredulous when I asked for ten lines of the hot sauce. (He really asked how many lines.) Boyfriend got the combo platter.  Both platters came to be around $20 total. A little pricy, but they are in a PRIMO location across ASU so they must need to pay the rent.  The owner - I think - asked me and my boyfriend how we were doing as we stood in line. Unfortunately, I wasn't really looking at him and didn't realize he was talking to us until I noticed he was looking at my boyfriend, and even then I was assuming he was talking to the group behind. I'm a little slow, ok.  We came at Saturday morning at 1am... so basically Friday night and it was still pretty busy... but the line moved fast.  Contemplating trying to baklava next time. And I'd probably ask for even more hot and white sauce next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. NEEDS ALL THE HOT SAUCE!!!!

f5QkfrwwGotnEErDTQhzfw.text: Driving around the ASU area of Tempe and made an executive decision to stop by my old neck of the woods! I was very surprised to see this location across the street from my old apartment complexes back in my college days. I recently tasted the food from the yelp Halloween event at the Arizona center, so this motivated me to trying it out. I like the simplicity of the menu and have the option of a small or regular plate for $7.95. I went ahead and had the chicken/gyro combo, combined with tomatoes, lettuce , yellow rice , topped with the meats. My toppings included onions, peppers, olives and some white sauce I forgot how to pronounce . The pieces of pita was a nice compliment and overall the food was okay, not the best but good tasting meal for a quick grab n go!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken and gyro combo plate

-KHa2NnsE8jWfs3JMxBemQ.text: Glad I finally got to try Halal Guys! Since this was opening weekend, there was a line to get in but it moved fairly quickly. I also appreciated the convenient parking in the back.   I ordered the small bowl with mixed beef and chicken which was a good size in my opinion. Overall, it was a nice and quick meal...I think the sauces are really what give this place their name, otherwise the food itself is pretty bland.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Small bowl with mixed meat

DBfkvg_ADS6xCChKm62PcQ.text: Love Greek/ Mediterranean food and was excited to try Halal Guys. What a COLLOSAL disappointment. Ordered the combo plate and while the rice was decent, the protein was horrendous; so overcooked/OLD, that the gyro was more like jerky. The pita was also stale and dry. The babaganoush left a weird aftertaste. And their take on tzatziki is a runny, calorie, fat and cholesterol laden, PRE-PACKAGED, "White Sauce" that is more like ranch than anything else. First and last visit; what a waste of money. There are lots of great Greek places around. Don't bother with this knock-off of what should be delicious, fresh and flavorful food.

aQv1bW_bh-GXdkwDLBJs7Q.text: I love The Halal Guys ever since meeting the carts first in NY. When a location came in South Bay, I was excited at the prospect of not having to travel so far for this comfort stable. Imagine my anticipation when I learned there was a location at home in the Valley!  But for me, this location felt like a Pass/Fail assignment in college. The components were all there - the meat, sauces, rice, veggies, pita. Chicken and beef tasted as I expected, as did the classic white sauce and spicy red sauce. Eating here is the classic Halal Guys flavor.  Yet with that solid foundation, it never goes further than that. Literally everywhere I've seen more fun iterations, such as a loaded fries instead of a platter. Or for the gluttons, there are more sub-upgrades within platters such as extra meat or rice that didn't break the bank. Here, what you see is what you get.   I think if I lived on campus, this might be a solid stop. But I feel like something's wrong if at dinner time Dutch Bros. is full but this place is nearly empty. I think I can better understand the lukewarm reaction Tempe has for this spot.

UYua-yYOtDputkg5OZEsbA.text: I had the Gyro sandwich and it was delicious! Extremely friendly staff! Great place for a quick lunch !

j43ySlqz40lg9wIKuENhtg.text: I hate that I did not get her name but the girl with the blonde hair and gorgeous eyelashes customer service was beyond awesome!!

-wF8COcp_nnzL4E0PQzg-g.text: Not near as good as in NY. This visit was below my expectations. The meats were dry as well as the rice. The food was so dry I could feel it getting stuck in my throat. The pita bread also had a strange taste to it, not sure what was going on with it. In NY they are making it fresh on the carts...maybe that was the difference? My husband and I wanted to control the amount of red sauce on it when we got home to eat, so we asked for togo packets of the red sauce. Beware---they charge a bunch for the togo sauce, but if you dine in, you get unlimited free sauce...Wish we would have stayed to eat as my food was so dry that I wish I could have added a TON more white sauce to help. Very bummed about this whole experience, just going to stick to the real deal when we go to NY.

_q3sO9a07vnIpLAmg9eKqQ.text: I didn't know this place existed until last week.  I've had the one in NYC and absolutely LOVED the food. It was my go to cart every time I visited. Now, This one in Tempe is pretty darn close. The portion sizes are good (not as big as NYC plates) and service is also great. We always seem to get there are the perfect time with no wait but it's usually pretty busy. The white sauce and the pita bread ROCK!

rbyyZMec3vvXiZPB-IHr3w.text: Heard a lot of hype about the expansion to AZ... was able to have my order delivered via UberEats.  We ordered the falafel sandwich, combo platter, and hummus to try a little bit of everything they offer.  Falafel was great, super crispy.  Everything was good, but I feel like we have better local Mediterranean restaurants here.  Will most likely reorder delivery for convenience.

1o2AJvrL-fYMDAJSwLwJ8w.text: I love this place! I always get the combo platter with white sauce, a scoop of hummus and a red sauce packet. It's simple but always delicious. Keep in mind the red sauce is HOTTTTT. My first time there, I was wondering why they didn't spread that sauce all around my platter and then I tasted the sauce and my mouth was on  with just one little taste. The employees are always super nice and efficient. The dining areas are clean. Everyone is always working and there's something about that makes me feel like this place really has a good system going. Only thing I wish would improve is the falafel. It's pretty hard on the outside and not always warm. All in all I'm a happy customer and I go probably once a week to satisfy my cravings!!

l2Gth_q_pkRJnHu38ZCYKg.text: So experience was awesome. Great food and fantastic service. I recommend the night crew if you ever get a chance to stop by, you won't be disappointed.

xt7tmff56UYLFZmrRe4SQQ.text: Really good food, but was very little. A combo plate didn't fill me up. But it was delicious.

V5XfLVVoIl833YN1okPkQQ.text: My girlfriend and I were excited to go to the hot new restaurant in town and when we got there we had to wait an hour just to get in the door. Yes it was opening day but in a chipotle style restaurant you expect them  to be fast. We were still excited to try it though because we had heard such good things about it and were very disappointed with the food. The white sauce was just mayonaise and they put a ton on and the hot sauce was very good but they put way too much on. The lack of pita bread was quite sad, they give you 3 little peices in their largest meal size and you really need it with food like that. I wont be going back soon anytime soon even with my half off a gyro coupon.

ffqJ0ed4wHFd2TUI0NS65w.text: This place was busy with a line out the door but it moved real fast and we were able to get a seat inside.  Very good food though and very nice portions..i got the chicken and gyro platter with rice which was filling.  The gyro didn't have that punch seasoning that I'm use to on a gyro but it was still tasty.  Its worth a second trip though for sure..parking is a bit tight too with Dutch brothers next door

GsBwzRfNp3J9GkxLusYlDA.text: Was very disappointed with food, unfortunately they have nothing going for them when it comes to food flavor. They have great location in an area that is saturated with middle eastern restaurants and in my opinion they rank the lowest among the rest. coming from NY I expected a lot more.

FxxO97BvfRBZ6YoMxjvneg.text: This place is Awesome! The food is delicious! The new management has really turn this place around!!  I spoke to the manager Vanessa about catering for my companies next business meeting. She answered all my question and helped me get it all set up! Just AWESOME!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Some platters and humus from my last time in!

6qmkuOv5VdeWAetdz7uEcQ.text: I really want give them a 4 star at the first time. But the second visit was not good as I expected. The chicken is too dry and the rice taste not like fully cooked.  Their service is also, not that good. :(

ruIcVDJlOGRR4SdvbzKExg.text: This is my second time eating halal guys. Unfortunately each time I was really hungry and the food was so good I could not take a pic for food presentation...my bad. Ok the first trip it was packed on a Saturday night! But the line moved very swiftly. I ordered the combo chicken and gyro platter with white and hot sauce, 2 falafel, baklava, and a fountain drink for a reasonable price imo. Then as I am paying the card demon hit and bam my card was declined! So in this packed establishment my card wouldn't go through and I knew I had the money! So I sit in a corner embarrassed and on hold with my financial institution. So as I'm holding and my bank is trying to get my card working during their maintenance / update, the Halal Guys manager comes up to me with my order and a fountain cup and said "this one is on us tonight," *my mouth dropped. "Oh no sir it's ok I really have the money!" And then he said "well I already entered it comped so you couldn't pay if you wanted to." And then he smiled. My card eventually worked that night but the kindness has one this place a new long time customer! Now to the food...I know ya'll didn't think just cause the manager was so nice I'd let the food review slide. No worries the food was excellent! I enjoy just mixing the whole platter together and have the flavors dance in harmony on my palate. Very tender meat, very very good baklava, and the hot sauce!... some may want to use sparingly, but if you like spicy I suggest a nickel size portion of it is fine. We'll gotta go finish my platter

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is the best I could do...it was pretty when I got it though.

gzB1qAfV_iNwJLYllvHc8w.text: There are so many fantastic middle eastern restaurants in the area. This is super mediocre even for a late night place. I got a combo bowl. Meh.

qZqIXhS6QBAHa95af6ExJA.text: The food is spectacular, They don't skimp on the meat. It has such amazing flavors that my husband who is chef material even loved the food. He actually is willing to go back there, which is a rare thing indeed. The rice was amazing. I very rarely can have rice so it has to be spectacular for me to eat it, and I ate all of it.  The pita was also perfect size, not to much and not to little. I can't wait for them to open up more so it is not so far away from my home. It makes a great date night. I also have never had better service than I did there. The staff couldn't have made it better. They were happy and made everything seem magical. I can't wait to go and eat here  again. If I could give it 10 stars I would.

iYnSMEYsVI7lGhfBURAxlA.text: Very disappointed. Once you run out of the hot sauce you're basically left with a meal you can find at any cheap Greek place for half the price. The white sauce is bland. Way overrated.

9ge937W_gZPYYT4IBa2E5w.text: I wish I can give no stars. This place is a joke, the chicken has no flavor, the beef, well I'm not sure what the hell it is, condiments are cold tomatoes & lettuce & they have this nasty extremely hot sauce that makes no sense & they put a glop of this white sauce on it & there rice had stale pieces in it. There is no way in hell this place is gonna last. I guess it started out as a cab stand & should've stayed a cab stand. Marketing does wonders I guess. Worst wannabe middle eastern I ever had.

WBV39nwHafBIRnsmhpNXvw.text: Got the food through UberEATS. The food was delivered on time.   We had ordered two platters plus two extra hot sauces . The platters are supposed to come with two white sauces(4) and 1 red sauce(2). When we got the order we only had three white sauces and 2 hot sauce and 2 were missing. I called and they apologized but they can't refund because it was through UberEATS.  The food quality is average at best. The rice has no flavor. The white sauce is mayo based nothing to rave about. The hot sauce might be just bit too hot. The meats are ok  I would stick to places like Baiz or haji baba!!!  Sadly won't be coming again anytime soon.

F_aOwD3j89WfV2ZH2A_YZA.text: Nostalgia. This place brings back memories of NYC... standing in the freezing cold after a late night out... standing in line... just waiting for the Magnificent Taste of The Halal Guys.... now it's here!!! That white sauce tho...

JWYA2iXw0YdyoaKEUowOeQ.text: Not a big fan of this place. The food was just ok. What they call Shawarma is just a chicken wrap and the chicken wasn't too tasty . 0v7RmuecTmhF2TwEFo5-zA.text: For those of you who "thought" that this location is anything like the ones in New York, you are absolutely wrong. First of all I know it a new place and it still trying to establish itself but you can tell the whomever owns this is a rookie. The owner charges for literally everything. One packet of White sauce- $1 Extra meat (Since they barely put meat)- $4 To top it off it's close to $10 bucks while New York has there menu at $7 for the regular size bowl.

hTPPmPMo3lAiKpSN-9Qtcw.text: Wanted a late night snack after work. Great customer service! Decided to get the combo plate.  The only thing I ate prior was wing stop and that never disappoints.  The combo at halal was not that good. Nothing special.  The next day I felt sick and couldn't keep anything down! First time I ever got food poisoning. Nightmare! I'm avoiding this place. vLh1AKzFSAhTAhqdXqI62A.text: Middle Eastern comfort food with meat, rice and salad. My gyro meat was dark, over cooked  and chewy...didn't look anything like gyro meat. A little bland. The olives helped, but the food could use a little more spice and vinegar. I really like my middle eastern food tangy. I'd love it if they offered middle eastern pickles or a simple vinegarette for the salad.  I'll give it another chance... Gave it another chance... Went back a second time. Gyro meat was dark and chewy again. I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly. I really wanted to like this place. I will say, you do get a lot of food for the price. Unfortunately it's lots of bland chewy food.

Next time will get the rice only with meat. They have this red sauce that's hotter than a jalapeno so be careful if spice is not your thing which is not mine. My friend had the white and red sauce and eyes watered instantly. Will be back again soon.

Food was okay, but I've had tastier. If we were just judging hot sauce, they would get 5 stars though. That stuff is pure fuego, and you'll want some of that white sauce to survive.

xyDLieS-xWqAnpWqUjB1kA.text: Is the hype real? That's what I wanted to know... I had in the streets of the city over ten years ago and I can still remember it. Yeah it might have been three in the morning and I may have been toasted but I do remember even eating the leftovers for lunch the next day. That's how you know it was good. This on the other hand wasnt horrible but just ehh avg. Portion size is generous for $9-10. Half the plate is lettuce half is rice with Indian spice and coloring so it truly is orange. The chicken was cooked right and not dry but all I could taste was salt and pepper. The beef cooked gyro style was pretty good. Decent portion of meats. The two sauces are white and red. The white would've been yogurt and onions combo on the cart in NYC... This I could barely taste  the red is the chili sauce and they ask how many lines you want of each (is this coke they sellin?). I got 5 white 7 red mouth was on fire! I happened to have tzatiki in the car (no lie) but it was still burning my mouth. Glad I got baklava to offset but wasn't enough. Like some other reviews said there are handful of middle eastern joints around asu that you wouldn't have to wait in line for and like even better.... Haji baba comes to mind but I've been away from that area for ten years. Either way glad I tried it.... Not in a rush to go back but it was edible.

WOo5EIEFYLZrdprEbqU7_Q.text: Ordered through uber eats. Food was cold and half my order was missing. Not the drivers fault. There is no flavor! The "white sauce" tastes like ranch. Very disappointed! Also I ordered a regular coke and got diet. I will never order or recommend this place.

IXT8vI7VIZX4JelmAZyLqg.text: I went in with high expectations since I've heard there famous. Boy was I disappointed. The lettuce they put in the platters is disgusting low grade iceberg white lettuce. And the meat is a little dry. This would have been okay had I not asked for the hot sauce. They asked if I wanted the hot sauce I said yeah and she asked how many lines. I usually love hot sauce and eat it on everything but this was not hot sauce, this was fire sauce. It was so hot I literally could not even finish my food. My mouth, lips and nose were burning and you can't fast any flavor other than hot. n2siSHCRNTyQ7x-Ab6UqOQ.text: Kinda bullsh* food.   They serve "yellow rice", because there likely isn't any saffron in it. h1sJ-Ld0VYFkwCMo6x--ew.text: This place is like a Chipotle service style for the Middle east. The combo meat bowls are usually what I get, I LOVE spicy and am honestly SO SURPRISED at just how lingering HOT (Spicy) the Red sauce is! It truly is FIRE! I love it!

2-WEcZbpixISXUaOMhwh0g.text: I've tried this food twice -- about a year ago a friend brought me some gyro sandwiches, and I also had them again yesterday. The first time I was unimpressed with the meat inside the gyro -- whatever that meat is supposed to be and the fact that it is chopped up, the consistency. For $8 you can surely get a real gyro in Tempe, like at Princess or Haji-Baba's (heck, even a faux middle-eastern place like Pita Jungle will do you a better pita than this fast food attempt at gyros for the same price). I tried adding some of the "famous white sauce" to help with the flavour, but I still didn't finish the gyro that my friend had acquired by take out. And the prices! Why would people pay sit-down restaurant prices for FAST FOOD?! So....yesterday was the second time to assess The Halal Guys, take out once again, a year later. The unthinkable happened: I bit into the gyro and was chewing my food, set the sandwich down, and then to my disbelief I watched a bug crawl out of the sandwich! I went online to see if they had any health violations, but could not locate any specific Tempe violations (there are so many Halal Guys locations, with varying degress of fast food health pass/fail scores). I AM a picky eater, but this is beyond bad.

8INmLRtvYRxxceJkU4kwug.text: I've enjoyed a platter of Halal Guys in 5 different states, the first being New York, followed by Texas, California, Virginia, and now Arizona. If you don't already know, Halal Guys is famous for its standard "chicken/lamb over rice" platter and duo of sauces ("white sauce" and "red sauce") that add all the flavor. No matter which Halal Guys you go to, you're going to be met with these basic options. Yet, every Halal Guys around the U.S. still manages to offer a slightly different taste and overall experience.   At this particular Halal Guys, I recommend the gyro platter over the chicken -- the gyro is plentiful in flavor where the chicken lacks. I also recommend checking the Hooked App before making your purchase, they frequently offer coupons that could score you a discount on your meal and sometimes free baklava, fries, and a drink. If you are going to choose between fries and baklava, I say go for the baklava. Halal Guys offers crinkle-cut fries, a fry that proves time and time again to be a disappointment. Their crisp-to-fluff ratio is nothing short of absurd.    It's not all bad here though, in fact the service here is quite speedy, the location is directly across from ASU, and there is plenty of parking and seating inside. Don't expect it to live up to the hype of NYC Halal Cart, but don't be bummed either --- this location is better than many of the other chains sprouting up around the West Coast.

1pJmlTw-6pjp9pzv2Tw9_g.text: Tried this place for the first time yesterday; the menu is simple, you can choose a plate or a sandwich, and then you choose your meat (chicken, gyro, falafel, there might've been another option) [tip*falafel takes 3 extra min to warm up, but soooo worth it] you get a bed of rice, lettuce, tomatoes, any sauces you want (they have a variety to choose from) they have toppings you can add too (jalapenos, onions, etc..). The food is made to your liking and preferences, the service was great. Love the area this is in, small parking lot but usually you can find a spot!

pBwdBe7lkGUE64V_QmSviA.text: This was our first time actually going INTO the store (we usually order online) all the staff was so friendly and gave us EVERYTHING we wanted and more! Highly recommend this place.

EN-xYScVaosIhgfGH5rQhA.text: Coming from Southeast Michigan, the Arab capital of North America, I am a bit of a Middle Eastern food snob. This place was aight but definitely not as good or fresh as the food back home.   I took the Yelp tips seriously and ordered extra extra sauce on my mixed falafel and chicken bowl. I also opted against the supposedly super duper hot sauce. I think the extra sauce helped moisten the (somewhat dry) chicken and the (not so great) falafels. In the bowl, there was shredded taco-like lettuce and tomatoes that didn't add much to the flavor. The pita bread was dry and definitely wasn't fresh. Bowl toppings were limited and the kalamata olives added the most flavor. The small side of hummus ($1) wasn't the best and I actually ended up throwing it away. All in all, the food seemed a bit prefabricated and didn't seem as authentic or homemade as what I'm used to.   I am sure this place is a nice, convenient option for some folks. The service was pleasant and efficient. I am glad I gave it a shot but I think I'd opt for another spot for my next Middle Eastern cuisine fix.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo chicken and falafel w extra extra white sauce per Yelp tips

Worst decision I have made for food in a long while the rice was dry and hard the meat had no flavor and the the pita bread for stuck together and soggy in the middle  there were three people there one in the front two in the back for the first 5 minutes I was there i had ordered a regular platter beef and pita bread with fries and a drink I already explained the food tho the fries were delicious as always despite sitting on the fryer dripping hanger if that's what it is called for 10 mins after it was done in the fryer and their Dr Pepper had high amounts of carbonation in it and based on personal experience it usually indicates that it is running low on syrup  I bring this up to who I assume was the manager on duty she proceeds to tell the other employees of the complaint they all try the soda and say nothing was wrong with it several times until it does what it did to me and exhaust itself of the air in the lines then proceed to gossip and complain of the complaints of other patrons calling it bullshit and other derogatory words in front of me as I had decided to dine in at that point and due to the actions and words of these employees I decided not to complain about my food and just "tough it out" even tho my body feels like it wants the food out I continue eating listening to the employees and watching there unsanitary actions like touching their glasses and face and other things and during all of this not wash their hands once but keep putting on fresh gloves when they go to serve an online order or other patrons who have entered the establishment  Safe to say I'm not coming to this location anymore and hopefully I can go to the other and not get this type of service or witness these things that I have tonight  Please get this fixed soon or the giant green A you have from the health dept will no longer be there and your reviews will continue to get worst

E5Zd7Qen6gmIh7R322mb4Q.text: I've had halal on the streets of NYC and honestly this place does a decent job.  However, it can never compare to the Halal street cart!  Needless to say, this smorgasbord of food is worth the try and is welcoming to have something new in the valley.  The plates itself were pretty affordable; $7.95 and up is not a bad deal.  I do remember eating like so as a younger man, but I tell I can only handle these kinds of meals once in a year maybe!  I ordered a larger halal plate as it came with some basmati rice, beef, chicken, iceberg, falafel, and topped with their special mayo-like white sauce.  I added a small dip of their spicy sauce on the side; and I'm glad I did so cause man that sauce was too spicy for me!  Overall, the lettuce and falafel helped with the texture providing a subtle crunch.  The chicken and beef was uber tender and soft to the bite.  The mayo sauce is what makes this dish pop!  However, it definitely was nothing like compared to what I had in NYC; not trying to knock it,but just based on shear experience having to hold a warm plate of food eating on the street corners of NYC.  Something about it, but maybe it's just in my head too!  In the end, The Halal Guys is worth the try since it's definitely affordable for a big plate of food and just something different! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

BxbF0Z8YJHanen-0iITLag.text: I had been wanting to check out The Halal Guys ever since they opened up in my area, so on a night I didn't feel like cooking dinner I headed on over!  Arrived a little before 5pm, it wasn't too busy, leaned you can either get a sandwich or a platter, I went with the chicken sandwich and ordered a side of falafel.  The chicken sandwich came on a nice warm pita, the chicken was tender and juicy had nice flavor to it, the sandwich had lettuce and it comes with a white sauce & and I also asked for the hot sauce too. This was a messy sandwich, but ooohhh sooo good!  I have to say though I was surprise with the side of falafel, there are 4 pieces of nicely fried falafel, but it did not come with any sauce, which I guess I expected it to, so by themselves with no sauce, they were little dry. Next time order a side of sauce or just make it a falafel sandwich.   Glad The Halal Guys are in the neighborhood and I'm sure I will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken pita.

q070rxHoBZPiHoWEyM_ztg.text: Horrible service.. Okay food (from that one time I had before).. Their door says open till 4am.. I got here at 2am.. every furnitures turned upside down for cleaning.. one employee inside.. She definitely knew I was standing at the door.. she turned her back and pretended I wasn't there..

RZy_nTDeA83B9ionXgr_wA.text: "I like it a little spicy but not too spicy... like J-Lo in pajamas."  Craig Ferguson, on The Chew  Any leftover, residue, stubborn, clingy germs from my cold a few weeks ago sprang back to life with the bit of red sauce I used.  I'm still coughing up a lung a few hours after eating!  Whoa!  Be careful with that red sauce, folks!  From a humble street cart in 1990 to becoming an international eatery, The Halal Guys have made it.  We ordered a side order of falafel, a Combo Platter [chicken & beef gyro], and a Falafel Platter.  I must admit that the falafel was a let down.  They were a bit dry and bland but a splash of White Sauce and a drop of Red Sauce fixed that up.  But when you're trying to not get an ass like Nicki Minaj, using excess White Sauce [seems like the love-child of mayo and Greek yogurt] to save your food is upsetting.  I would say the Combo Platter is the way to go.  Platters are a filling and simple dish of iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, and some rice.  3.5 stars!  At $9 for the large "regular" platter [I couldn't even finish half] combined with the late hours, I'm sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. My lips are on fire.
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combination platter with olives and jalapeños.  Gotta get that red sauce, of course.
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Falafel platter.

07qfqsu4R2zCKBT6eyqlYQ.text: Halal Guys was decent. This chain sells basically fast food Middle Eastern dishes. The menu is limited to chicken, gyro and falafel as your base to go in either sandwich or platter form.   I went with the small size falafel platter. Half of it was filled with iceberg lettuce salad, and the other half was filled with seasoned rice. 4 small falafel pieces were placed on top along with a few pieces of pita triangle. You have your choice of add ins (I added onion, jalapeno, and olive) and you will also have your choice of white, hot, or BBQ sauce. I went with white and hot sauce.   Overall, I wasn't too impressed. For $8 I would have liked something additional to go with the pita triangles, such as a scoop of hummus or baba ganoush. The falafel pieces were pretty small, rock hard on the outside, with a slightly moist filling. The falafel looked mass-produced as if they came from a mold since they had more of a gumdrop rather than spherical shape. For a platter filled only with inexpensive salad+rice with tiny falafel and few pita triangles I think it was definitely overpriced.   My husband had the gyro sandwich which he said was pretty good. The gyro meat didn't look like your typical thinly sliced meat from a spit. It was more like small chunks of meat, and he said it was well seasoned and tender.  As for the sauces, I liked the white sauce with its mild creamy flavor and the red hot sauce packed quite a punch!   If I go here again I'll skip on getting the falafel and will probably try one of the sandwiches.

I did a combo of the white sauce and bbq- perfect together. I did light sauce since they tend to put a lot on (I think most people would prefer more but I'm more health conscious). Most of the excess calories and sugars come from that white sauce (but it is super yummy). I actually think the bowl without pita and light sauce is a healthy athletic option- good quality calories in a good blend of protein, carbs and fat.  EXCEPT: I wish they made the white sauce with better ingredients- if they used olive oil instead of nutritionally poor oils, I'd eat it way more often (I avoid bad fats as much as I can).  Definitely still 5 stars and a big plus that they are open pretty late. Phoenix area just doesn't have much in the way of variety in late night food. Cheers

mJwW5JTeg790axouGjFPFw.text: I rate all restaurants on the same consistent fair standards of food taste/quality, service, cleanliness and value.  However I weight my reviews based on the measure of how much effort the owner puts into their work ... hence a mom & pop one-location place that is struggling and not yet quite on point may get a higher rating from me to encourage them and others to give them a chance than a pretentious trendy corporate conglomerate that thinks high prices equate to high quality but they are lazy, sloppy and serve sub-par food.  Here is why this place didn't cut it for me.  SERVICE  Pitiful. With the lone exception of the inadequately trained and overwhelmed greeter who starts your order, who valiantly struggled to work under incredibly negative conditions with co-workers who were rude, indifferent and lazy. He deserves better than to work here.  FOOD TASTE/QUALITY  I had a Gyro platter which was supposed to be chicken and gyro meat.  Except they ran out of chicken and said it would be at least 20 minutes to make some.  Despite having a vertical rotisserie in plain sight I never saw them use it. The meat was scooped from a huge food service steam tray. The words that come to mind to describe it are fake bac'n bits, low-grade jerky or puppy treats - it was dry, chewy and tasteless. This was served over the driest bright yellow rice I've ever had (I seriously thought it was old dried out shredded American cheese).  Optionally you can add lettuce that's poured pre-chopped from humongous vats that look like a case of e-coli waiting to happen and some thin dry slices of pita.  It's all drenched in a tasteless "white sauce".  CLEANLINESS  This place reminds me of an army mess hall. The benches are bare concrete and the tables are never cleaned. It's typical fast-food fare.  VALUE  At ten bucks my combo plate was a poor value by any standard.

It's really not bad, but not amazing for sure.

b-U9ukkg5qa5x0sVcBPQWg.text: The sauces are the best part. I ordered the platter and it was mostly rice. It was good to try and I would eat here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

0XesbyOIqAruTXsLMiRFTw.text: I was pretty excited to see these guys open up. Stopped in and got a combo plate. Everything tasted great and fresh. It was plenty for one person and I even had some left to share. I will definitely be going back.

-cvdZ_ssWGXOhYMim6lrIQ.text: The food was amazing! And the customer service was even better. Definitely lived up to the hype

H28CRRhEyl5iYYYW-ueaRA.text: absolutely love the place, food, Staff and vibe. food taste great and everyone there is very helpful. will definitely go back soon.

3s-yoCcQbTxB_5T2oyoyTA.text: Walked in for lunch with a friend on a late sunday afternoon and there wasn't a big line. I got the chicken platter and my friend ordered the chicken combo platter. I haven't had such worse food in a while. The chicken tasted awful, the pita was stale and the lettuce wasn't fresh at all. I  am not very picky with food, but this was the worst experience I have had so far eating middle eastern food here in the valley. My friend had the same view and we both were extremely disappointed with the food. Lucky to have not fallen sick after the meal. Definitely not coming back again.

VB94LrrKG0wUNaWpCEkowA.text: I am new to the area.  A coworker showed me this restaurant about 90 days ago.  I make it my regular Friday or Saturday evening stop.  Great food.  Great prices.  Great service.  I would also like to name check Crystal.  She has been at the restaurant since I started going there.  She always makes my regular plate with beef gyro exactly as I like it - extra tomatoes!!!  Its great to see her cheerful, happy, smiling face every time I go.  She is partly what makes my Halal dining experience worth it.  Crystal is a True asset to the company and I hope that the company can do everything that they can to retain her, and move her up in the company.  I don't think there is a better ambassador for The Halal Guys than Crystal.  Thanks for the great food, and thanks, Crystal, for the great service.  I look forward to my regular plate, and being waited on by Crystal, next weekend.  This review is for the Tempe-Phoenix store on Rural Road.

N2Mc5jMFBH78NW9jmRXuWQ.text: Their food is complete shit. I have never had worse Middle Eastern food. It's like they ate crappy Middle Eastern food, and then shat it out into the tray that they served us. Their white sauce is total crap. It's mayonnaise. Why not just call it mayonnaise so we don't get our hopes up that it might be tzatziki? I enjoy hot sauce, even siracha and habanero hot sauce, but the red sauce was completely inedible. Obscenely high in calories and fat (330 calories and 36g fat per pack of white sauce). Complete waste of money.

an8UJ3WoUJY1r5eDJGAwzw.text: Rating of 3.5 stars.   Cant really compare it to the NY carts on 53rd and 6th, but overall the food was good. Its awesome AZ finally has a "CnR."
