dIhrs618mdOHWh-kDELBxw.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this place! It's so freaking good. I came here about a week ago for the first time and definitely have been back since. The falafel is SO good, probably the best falafel I've had in a while. The hummus, rice and their tahini and white sauces are so tasty as well. The store is super clean, the customer service and all of the employees are always super nice when I go in. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who's in the area or has been thinking about coming here because it's worth it!

eBlmSwSvYhUSwQ0mO-GNhw.text: I've actually been here during their grand opening. I was a little skeptical about trying this place since I know the real taste of New York halal guys. I actually thought the one here is similar. I thought the food tasted the same but their cut of meat is way different. I feel they really mince their meat. I think I'll try this place out again because it's really good during those late nights.

eYvS8MJxKuJ5LijhvfJqAw.text: I'm giving this place a 4 because I totally think the original halal guys cart in NY is so much better.   I love how simple of a menu they have and you get a lot of food. The red sauce is extremely spicy..so I would totally put a dab of it on your food at first. Otherwise, I love the chicken and rice platter with LOTS of their white sauce.

9baivuCp1E3deVDjyM8oDw.text: Picked up some family from the airport and we wanted to grab a quick bite to eat after a late flight arrival.  To our surprise this place was open late (in fact, very late today, open until 4 AM).  This place is a one of those strip type store fronts with about 6 businesses.  The only draw back could be the that they share a entrance with Dutch Bros Coffee.  So during peak periods could be difficult getting to park.  Once we walked in, we were immediately greeted by a friendly gentleman.  My family ordered chicken gyro "sandwiches" and I order the beef.  The guy that prepped the food was quick and really stuffed these sandwiches/wraps with everything.  I was really pleased with how well the meats were flavored, some places don't season enough, but no questions asked here.  The actual store front dining area has about 12 tables that will seat about 4 each...a nice medium size place.  Everything appeared to be clean.  I would definitely be back for a quick complete sandwich.

aTpiUkcZ2o3gs_MbxeFzjw.text: Delicious! Meals are big enough to share. It taste almost as good as the one in New York. My favorite is the combo platter.

MII0hL5bLXenuH8ma6ua1A.text: I eat here too often. The food is incredibly flavorful and comforting. I always get a gyro platter. Just a warning the red hot sauce is pretty spicy. Start with one line and then add more if you want it. Actually I would recommend adding it yourself after you get your food. Some of the people are a little more free with the sauce than others and you might end up with more spice than you intend.

QK9t59JnLP7D5TkbySqO9A.text: I'm sad. Really wanted Greek food and our go to spot is always closed on Sunday so we thought Halal Guys! Always wanted to try them, heard good reviews, Opa! Lets order! The fun stopped there. DoorDash delivered (driver was great 5 stars) temperature of food was what we expected. Now time to eat. First bite is always the pita bread, exciting...no. It was stale and dry and meh. Okay open the container, little pieces if chopped up gyro, chicken, rice, iceberg (who even uses that anymore?), and diced tomatoes. Looks good, wait is the gyro meat actually curling up do to dryness? Yes it is. Sigh...no worries I'll fix that with some delicious tzatziki, wait there's no tzatziki??? But there is "white sauce" WTHECK is that??? Thinking it's ranch. Sigh....ok. So,  let's wrap this up with this...food was cold, over cooked, dry, old, and inedible. Can we get our $30 back. Beware of Greeks bearing old dried food. You have been warned.

5RkDYGWfDofDHBwsKJd3fw.text: Very disappointed. The new management doesn't seem to care about the staff or customers. Nobody is friendly or recognizes repeat customers.  Most if not all of the former crew and staff from when they opened are gone and now nobody really knows what they are doing.   The one shining star at night is Alex the only person I recognized as being there a while. He deserves a promotion at least he knows the way this brand works.

1RK0nnuF7ZBdbpBUoRYLgw.text: I LOVE their food! I ALWAYS stop in to get a platter and some hummus (my fave!) whenever Im in the area! And everytime I go in the staff is always so friendly and helpful!!

5ailVr9RZ7YRzry0fkZ0dQ.text: Not sure why this place has 3.5 stars. Only thing I wish was if this place was closer to Gilbert.   Everything was good! Finally a spicy sauce that is spicy! I'll be coming back to this place a lot.

z4xkhgnssBM5jFnaYDLtGQ.text: DONT BELIEVE THE HYPE! As I walked in, I was greeted by an awkward employee with little to no customer service skills. He was super weird and a little creepy. I Ordered falafel. It was nothing like I expected. Everything was room temperature and the falafel was dry and wasn't warm and steamy like I am used to. I will not come back here.

i3_R_q4frTB_y4eoBwwvHA.text: Not so good..... but the server was so very nice! I wanted to tip her but she said they prefer reviews.  Would have rather tipped the hard working server especially since the food was so mediocre! Hummus was the only "good" part of a chicken platter.

cxWFi6QIh1NLgkG21SAbLA.text: I came in because I heard all the great hype. Came in around 3:30pm and there was a long line and I thought.. yah this place better be awesome. Unfortunately, it fell flat! I ordered the gyro bowl. The rice and gyro meat where so dry. I was so disappointed. The only thing great about it was their white and hot sauce. I had to keep adding the sauce to put some moisture back into the meat. Unfortunately I will not back. Sorry not sorry!

OAuR4gvp6AX_PAU_AVCBSQ.text: An unfortunate let-down as everything just seemed saturated and un-fresh, and a bit expensive for what I got. The pita and tomatoes were the winners of my combo plate, but that's a far cry from a compliment as it's the entirety of the meal I should be touting.   -Gyro meat was too strongly seasoned, overly wet with juices -Chicken was chunky and fatty, not nicely chopped or shredded -White sauce was alright but nothing signaturely fresh and clean -Baklava costs $2.00 for the BITE portion I got...don't get me wrong, I don't mind the portion but TWO DOLLARS for something less than tomorrow gourmet...?! Please!   Service: Lastly, I actually entered the establishment twice and wasn't acknowledged the first time within the 2 minutes I reviewed the menu, so I went to check out another establishment. 30 minutes later I came back and it took, again, over a minute to even be greeted. I will not be back, and unfortunately, given the entire experience, I've got a less than pleasant taste in my mouth for The Halal Guys.

ai3OEsAL28lYGQjCsyzUNA.text: I wouldnt even call this Mediterranean food. Your choices are lettuce, tomato, rice, chicken, falafel, gyro and sauces. That is it. Nothing else. They marketed the crap out of this plave online and I was thoroughly disappointed.   There is one thing I pat them on the back for, and that is their hot sauce. They are not joking when they say it is hot. Got one tiny squirt on my food and I couldnt even finish. Neither could my companion. In fact I made him stop at the nearest gas station so I could buy a bottle of chocolate milk to make the pain go away.   Completely regret going here but their sauce is nuts. Burns coming out too. If spice is your thing they are worth checking out for the hot sauce. Too bad they don't have anything palatable for you to put it on.

WRIua_d_6D0m5xGP8Fl2Eg.text: Love going here to remind me of when I would eat chicken and rice in New York City. I get the combo plate with gyro and chicken with white sauce and just a couple strips of hot sauce.   Remember the hot sauce is HOT!! So start off with a little and add more if you need it. If you have too much, it might be too hot and you won't be able to enjoy the food.

WpUBomN26auNyw_yeBF_QA.text: If you're craving that NY Halal Guys, this is it. Just as good as the trucks in the city. It's a little greasy and heavy but if that's what you're looking for, it's great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. A combo of these bad boys only make that combo platter better.

lGl8F-93JyID5vsles38xA.text: The consistency & quality is the star of Halal Guys. Yes, of course there is better food out there for a better price. But to be able to maintain friendly & fast service while serving a consistent platter of meat, rice, sauce, & bread across the country is truly amazing.   Even with a long line in front of you, you'll be served in a timely manner. Order it thru delivery, and it's a nearly identical experience as going to get it yourself.   The chicken is a bit on the bland side.  The beef gyro is nice & zesty.  Pita is soft & tastefully chewy.  Rice is decent & mild on the flavor.  Salad is used to cool it down when you get overzealous with the hot sauce.  White sauce is decent. Bbq sauce makes it better & fun, The Hot sauce is best taken in moderation.   And a side of fries is surprisingly tasty.    I've been to this location about 8 times this month & will continue to enjoy my combo platter any time of the day.

--xTCNQPVzNzgSoXJJh2Jw.text: I was really excited to try out The Halal Guys and happened to in Tempe for work. Sadly, I was pretty disappointed. It was just meh. I really don't like giving poor reviews, but there's no way I can give this more than two stars, purely from a food standpoint.  I used a THG recipe at home once and my version far outshone what I just ate.  I love falafel and I was in the mood for something tasty, so I headed inside the compact storefront and ordered the small falafel bowl, which consists of lettuce, tomato, yellow rice and three generously-sized falafel pieces. The guy on duty asked me if I wanted pita bread (after checking to make sure I wasn't a vegetarian, so I'm not sure what that was about... are they made with lard?) and gave me about half of a pita's worth.  Once my bowl was assembled, I could add extras like onions, jalapenos, green bell peppers, pitted Kalamata olives, hot sauce, and white sauce. I chose the bell peppers, olives, and white sauce. Kudos to the worker for warning me that the hot sauce was "hotter than 20 jalapenos," because otherwise I would've tried it and been in pain! The service was pretty quick and efficient, and the place was clean. I didn't love that half the seating is concrete benches. It looks sleek, I suppose, but sorta gives off a prison vibe and wasn't very comfortable.  I was just completely underwhelmed by the food. There was almost a total lack of flavor. The white sauce lent moisture to the bowl, but nothing more. Perhaps they need a hot sauce that's somewhere between flavorless and burning with the fire of 1,000 suns.  I think I'll try a mom-and-pop for Middle Eastern food next time I'm in the area.

LrxQjhn5dV8wJJDcQTzyxA.text: These combo platters are serious business! Best 9 dollars spent on food ever! The meats have good flavor and the sauces are awesome.  This is a tone of good food and the management staff seem pretty awesome.  This place is always busy but never a really long wait.

h1InzZqoQBlJbWOv5fPqRg.text: I am so sorry I gave this place a chance.  I asked them to cut my nieces gyro in half.  They said the manager says they can't do that. I asked for a knife even a plastic one and they said they can't help me.  Horrible customer service.  Food is nothing special either.  Go somewhere else that cares about customer service and avoid this place.

vmkmhhYkHMStFf2fhtgraQ.text: Anticipated their opening since I found out they were opening here in Tempe, AZ.   Started following The Halal Guys on Instagram, won a contest they held, winning a free platter way before they even opened here.   The Grand Opening was great. Busy, but definitely worth the wait. Owners outside greeting and talking to the crowd.  But now on to the most important part of all... THE FOOD!  Let's just speak in emojis   The Chicken and Gyro... so moist, deliciousness bursting in your mouth. Not to mention their special white sauce .  The falafel was being given out as samples, super yummy as well. With our order we also tried the hummus and fries.  The Halal Guys did not disappoint! #1

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. White Sauce and A line of Hot.  More hot sauce please. Try it on the side as it is spicy!
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Platter and the Combo ( Chicken &amp; Gyro) Platter. Side of Hummus and Fries!
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

vr_N7aISKicSGAcVRHD_gA.text: This was my first time trying this restaurant. I gave it chance despite the negative reviews people gave me. It's more of an American twist to traditional Greek food. I expected the meat to have a little more flavor but it was dry. The rice portion is outrageously small. They give you one scoop that comes with the platter and you have to pay $1.50 for a second scoop. I find the price to be a little high for the quality and amount of food that was included in the platter.

RHueTqiCSELCvSt1KliFJg.text: Im debating between 2 or 3 stars. But since the place provides a great customer service, which is one of the essentials for a customer to come back, I will do 3. Thats one positive thing. Another thing to consider is the good flavor/taste of the chicken and beef gyro. The white sauce compliments it, big time. The platter was good too.  Now, comes the Hummus, the Baklava, the Fries. I get it, not the main menu entry but I don't get how you can make Hummus so simple and bland. The Fries was even the same. Simple and bland. The Baklava - the only dessert they have yet tasted like it was old. I can get a better baklava at a middle eastern store. Dont waste your money buying one! Unless they improve it. As you can see, few other yelpers said the same thing about baklava.  UPDATED:  Wow! I thought there would be an improvement after seeing reviews of how bland, tasting like cardboard and old the BAKLAVA is! But no, its the same piece. Such a waste of my money! I gave it another try thinking my review and other customers would change a thing but this place can care less.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dont buy Baklava from this place

1q1dBsAvymNqgTpPxE4Zaw.text: Really filling meal that never disappoints. Good portions and white sauce is amazing.

pxxbHKQ_JhoPoGFMXIiq0w.text: I was so excited when I heard they were opening up a location right across the street from ASU, however after going several times, I'm terribly disappointing. The street carts in NY are better and even have Sriracha. This place is mediocre at best and don't have Sriracha.

DG-uTgxmrYZ0A3qfc0TO5Q.text: horrible customer service. I ordered delivery they didn't include any of the sauce at all which I ordered extra of. just a dry bowl with rice and meat. I contacted them never heard anything back was never compensated. The workers are also rude every time i'm in there. would definitely avoid this place

RXncItqSe4eCQvUmNlV1KQ.text: I had really high expectations for this place after hearing all the raving reviews. I wasn't blown away but I also wasn't disappointed.  It's a chipotle style concept. I tried the combo plate with chicken & gyro meat. It was decent! I skipped the hot sauce though after a warning from the employees.  I'm sure I'll be back if I'm looking to grab a fast food option.

y27_daKjT6pP8OOGE-YXxw.text: I just moved here from NYC and I was a regular at the halal guys food carts on 53rd street. Here it's quite different from there to say the least, the restaurant seems very clean and it almost has this chipotle style service. I miss how quick and simple it was in New York to be honest, here you have many extra ingredients that they did not offer in NY like jalapenos, tomatoes etc but I don't know the rice does not seem fresh and the gyro meat is different from what they used in NY. I was happy to see they had a restaurant in the Phoenix area but I was kind of disappointed when I compare it to the one in NY. Might go back when I feel homesick for NYC.

iMlxb4fqIZpVkldSxRpIsQ.text: Amazing staff and service! I've had better falafel here then in Jerusalem! Efficient assembly line style and a great price for excellent food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

ANEmiIKJLqY89BbJaZcDhw.text: This is such a simple concept!   The menu has only a few options and it really makes the service fast.   BEWARE of the hot sauce. I have never tasted sauce so hot. I think some people must get it just to feel the ridiculous heat. Nevermind that though because the platters are great with just the white sauce.   If you watch the video running on the screen you'll see the meat over French fries. That's not on the menu but definitely a cool "secret" menu item.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

l0cAuKzszxTJI_IkA2cDpA.text: This place had some serious hype when it opened, so I finally tried it for the first time.  I went there today (a Sunday) around noon and it wasn't busy at all. I got a regular combo platter with white sauce, ONE line of hot sauce, a scoop of hummus and some onions.  This place definitely lives up to the hype.  Both the chicken and the beef gyro were well-seasoned and tender. Good flavor on the rice.  That white sauce set set it off, and the one line of hot sauce was all I needed!  The hummus was just as good and fresh as they described it, creamy and lemony.  Everything was pretty tasty, especially when I folded it up in the pita triangles.  I wanna go back and try a sandwich next time, and I heard the falafel's great too.  Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States

Q_a4Ufezle_QZZEGBemTzA.text: Great gyros! Love the food and their rewards program is great, I get a free drink almost every visit.

EUtrnADywSpsYKRT4HnpTA.text: Miss Halal Guys since I first had it in NYC Summer last year. One of the most anticipated places to visit this year. The long 50 minutes wait in line plus 10 minutes walk from the car on Grand Opening day was all worth it! Both the service and food were great, friendly, quick and tasty. I just wished that they're more generous with the sauce, both white and red sauce, pretty stingy compare to NYC ones. Tried the baklava in NYC, not here but assumed tastes the same, it's way too sweet for my taste. Cannot wait for HG to open one on the West side.

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo plate (beef and chicken)

Gp9El9nUrOyaw9NuDaxK1w.text: First I was schooled that it's not Mediterranean food it's traditional middle eastern food.......thanks.  Second if you're going to drain students trust funds by charging 10 bucks a plate for rabbit food and a small portion of protein. Can u at least spend some money on 2 ply toilet paper.  After I'm done eating said rabbit food I have to expel some waste. Unfortunately my hand was wearing most of my own waste due to cheeping out and having 1 ply.  U have ur business on a college campus with guys who like to eat and usually spend a fair amount of time ingesting garbage.  The make up of said waste will have a thick consistency. So please Nickel and dime owners invest in some upgraded products.    Thanks

7cwv5rC4nkp7mFFaAO7IJw.text: Pretty meh.  I ordered the been gyro platter.  The service was quick, but my pita was stale.  The beef gyro had good flavor, but the yellow Jasmine rice was bland.  I am not sure how they got it to be such a rich gold color, but I doubt they used saffron.  I couldn't taste any other fragrant spices in the rice either.  I probably won't be back with good choices like Even Stevens and Poke Bowl right next door.

INaRBFe3RdD9mm5bmlU_UA.text: Customers beware! The red sauce is super spicy! But delicious. A few drops and my mouth is on fire!   I like how The Halal Guys is one of the few places that open late. The food can be inconsistent which is why I give it 4 stars. When it's good it's really good and I finish all of it. When it's not good, the meat can be too dry. I think it's better to ask for the white sauce on the side. That way, you're in charge of how much sauce is mixed in. The Pita that they give isn't fresh and warm which is something I don't like.

CMl1nDUS2HVPgFlVZo8_Yg.text: So I work in Chandler and today I drove 46 minutes to and from The Halal Guys to satisfy my craving, okay? I'm Halal-ed out now though but I'm glad I went. I went for the first time on Friday night and it was everything. I ordered a regular size chicken platter with extra white sauce and a DOLLOP of red sauce. That red sauce is nothing - NOTHING - to play with. My mouth was on fire but it was so good. It's an intense burn but it fades out quickly so I guess that's the silver lining to it being so hot, lol. My husband tried some while we were driving and he almost wrecked the car, he couldn't comprehend how people enjoy it! I also ordered one piece of baklava and a fountain drink. Side note: did you know Fanta made ginger ale? It's a faint ginger flavor but it was great. Also, it was my first time having baklava and it's so good. I was looking up recipes today to try to make it sometime soon. Anyway, I enrolled in the rewards program and when I went today, I got a free drink. If you ever forget to have them add your reward points to your account in store, you can always do it online. I actually preferred my meal more Friday than I did today. I don't know if it's because it was later at night and maybe the chicken had been marinating longer but I just felt like it had more flavor. I asked for extra white sauce but it wasn't nearly enough because 34 of the way through my platter, it was pretty dry. And of course, it isn't the same as the authentic NY Halal Guys but it's worth the 45 minute drive from my apartment in Arizona!

photos.caption: Photo of The Halal Guys - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken platter with an order of baklava. This picture is not doing the food justice but look at the portion size!

mY5lUu6j3YD1KUy4fDI4Mw.text: VERY tender gyro platter.  Most tender we have EVER had.  Very large portion.  Fresh lettuce & tomato to build my own.  Love the 2 packs of white sauce that's given.  Enjoyed the take out.  Will order again.

Eb-gR_D-Uf9ayTHKX4ZquA.text: Now the people are nice and the food is fresh and the place looks nice, but being Halal is not enough to make this an authentic middle eastern Gyro spot. It lack authenticity and flavors with the frozen falafels. In a college town full of incredible middle eastern restaurants, I was very disappointed . I was looking forward for a long time to visit this place. The Gyro looked pre-frozen and processed meet. The chicken was shredded as it belonged to a BBQ chicken sandwich. Not good.

mixw3WrM6zItIkpSgDkY2w.text: Quick, clean & delicious! I will definitely be coming here at least once a week  (P.S. Hot sauce is REALLY hot. Like fire in your mouth and other end hot.)

FyZcp7ZlSvpOWTjGvuHAow.text: One of my favorite places to eat in NY is Halal Guys, so my family and I were counting the days for the Tempe location to open.  We visited Halal Guys on Saturday for lunch and as predicted there was a line out the door.  It took about 30 minutes for us to order our food.  We ordered 2 gyro and 2 combination sandwiches.  We sadly were disappointed as the sandwiches contained barely any meet (not flavorful) and mostly lettuce.  They were also completely cold inside. I can't even compare the gyro sandwich to local Greek shops in the Scottsdale/Tempe area, as this was not like the gyros i have previously eaten at Halal Guys.  I hope this changes!  I don't mind paying more, but they need to get the recipe and quantity to be closer to the original if they want to compete in this market or use the Halal Guys name.

ItS7Tqq-XVrN1DgM_tiPMg.text: Over hyped, too greasy and over priced. Tried the wrap and platter and didn't like either. If you are middle eastern this is not what you would expect the white sauce tasted like mayo and ranch. Hummus was below average not worth paying extra. Red rice was crunch and flavorless. Would not recommend to an American or a middle eastern. Definitely not middle eastern food.

dSvryiBwIlI7n0vNCJ1A4Q.text: If you're looking for disappointment you've come to the right place. Service was prompt but the food is devoid of quality.

PoGTO875a-opIIs5arFGAQ.text: The fact they are open hella late gives them four stars, dank hummus but unfortunately the quality of chicken and falafel wasn't as good as hoped, but if your looking for late night now that Oliveos is closed in the neighborhood it works

a0FRlr3ij02XmXlKtX0m_Q.text: it's definitely good for what it is, middle eastern food truck food. However, it did not live up to the hype that it had prior to opening. It's a little bit pricy for the portions and I feel like they're a little stingy with the sauce and meat. The meat is a little dry (chicken). Overall, pretty tasty with the sauces. Haji baba is better and more bang for your buck in my opinion

_wsaptlHpEddAwq83ju9cQ.text: only got three stars cause they forgot my pita....I know right?? And the super duper flimsy to go containers... the dollar store contains are sturdier then theirs!

Hp99BD9WPA0lQcVaJr6JLQ.text: The first time I had Halal Guys was at their home base in NYC and while their franchise isn't *exactly* the same as ordering fresh of the cart, it is still delicious and makes me feel like I have a piece of home nearby! Their white sauce is exactly the same, and so is their hot sauce (beware putting too much on your food if you're not a hot sauce lover, it will numb your lips lol). This place is very busy so expect a line as well, and if they are out of something- try a meat you wouldn't usually have, it's all delicious. Rice is perfect, salad is refreshing, and they have extra sauce you can grab from the back if you need more. Check it out while you're in phoenix!

GtmH0lxtExtOSOaYSFUyIA.text: Flavorless and completely unsatisfying. My group had gyros with fries and the chicken platter. How can spiced gyro meat taste like air? There is literally no flavor to it. The white sauce tastes like mayonnaise but somehow blander. The chicken at least was spiced but was chopped, tough, and stringy. The pita bread is very good but that was about the only positive we could come up with. We ended up going elsewhere later that night to get food that was remotely satisfying. That this is some sort of famous east coast chain is completely confounding to us. Will never return.

TRbvJJ4IoBRDqWgKFY4wdg.text: Interesting concept; have heard bout it & wanted to try it. Very ltd menu, reasonable prices & healthy. Not sure I see all the fuss, prob wouldn't go outta my way but will go back...

JPF-HWJz3e4TBGR_LkHBpg.text: Really enjoy their food! Fast, delicious, well-rounded meals! And we met the General Manager the other day when we were in there and he was very courteous, making sure all the customers were pleased.

fmTjqqkZF57tPINpbJsH4A.text: I ordered Halal Guys on the UberEATS app from my hotel. The food came quickly and in amazing condition! I was worried I may not get plastic ware, as that happens a lot with to go orders, but I was pleasantly surprised. Definitely getting this again!

9ohUu596Zw1G1mOpXZ7COw.text: This place had So much hype upon opening and I was pretty excited because I love Mediterranean food. I'm actually pretty bummed to say this but I was not impressed in the least bit. I did order from UberEATS which came within 20 minutes of ordering and the food was still warm so that wasn't the issue. The issue was the food had zero flavor. I ordered a regular combo platter and half the platter was lettuce....... the rice was undercooked, still hard and had no flavor. The portion of chicken and beef was really small so I was left with undercooked rice and an ton of lettuce. The best part of the meal was the white sauce which was what made this meal edible. However I will warn you the hot sauce is HOT. I'm someone who eats hot sauce on everything and this sauce Is almost unbearable, good but really spicy! Sadly The Halal guys did not live up to my expectations and was seriously overpriced for what your given. I'm willing to try them again and hoping it was a fluke night but damn I'm disappointed!

5hYv4BG6TO2TF6GJ84PbDw.text: So ordered through Uber eats and read disclaimer on the hot sauce and basically disregarded it since I  love spicy stuff. However I am very pleased that this sauce kicked my ass I just want to thank them for creating it

Zk38Uo-LFaeXGqZCakwHxQ.text: I ordered a gyro sandwich tonight from The Halal Guys. My gyro arrived overlooked, with the gyro meat actually breaking one of my teeth due to it being overcooked. In addition, I asked for hot sauce and did not receive any, on my sandwich or on the side. Negligence on the part of such a successful business should not be overlooked. I'm a loyal customer strongly reconsidering my loyalty.

QDmiWbS3T8IwwE9T7Gu49w.text: I was excited when I heard a new Mediterranean Restaurant opened near ASU. Haven't tried Ys Restaurant up the road yet, but I decided I'd give The Halal Guys a try. The interior is pretty clean and the staff is very friendly and professional. I ordered the gyro and falafel combo. I really enjoyed the texture and flavor of the falafel, bread, and rice. I know to order a drink next time because, after enjoying those tastes, I nearly choked on falafel. I only docked one star because my gyro wasn't wrapped. I docked another star for the high pricing. Otherwise, I think this is worth another try.

x50UUXBSXeY38krCt32l6w.text: Loved it! The service was great the line moved fast. I had the combo plate. The meat had great flavor and was great with the white sauce. I dared to try the hot sauce - the flavor was wonderful but couldn't handle the heat, be careful! Looking forward to trying the sandwich and if I got a plate again I would do all gyro. It was really nice to dine with  a great diverse group of people enjoying world food.

gnTOcY-A6FDYof-uw-F3_Q.text: My initial visit to The Halal Guys had me impressed and hungry for more. I was excited to indulge in their food and welcomed The Halal Guys as a potential competitor to Chipotle in the Tempe-ASU area.   On my first visit, the lines were out the door, which left me feeling both excited for the food and irritated because I had to wait. After reaching the entrance and getting past the bouncer, I approached the friendly staff at the counter and asked for a combo plate. I glanced at the menu and looked around the store, but had to double take at the menu one more time to make sure I read the right prices. 8.99$ for a regular platter. When making my decision, I looked at the man in front of me, who opted for the costly 6.99$ wrap, and noticed his sandwich was much smaller than the menu image made it out to be. Assured that I had made the right choice, I proceeded to walk along the counter, mesmerized by the teamwork and mass production of food by the staff. The employee added two heaping spoonfuls of rice which I oddly assumed was cheese, a scoop of crunchy water (lettuce), a scoop of flavorless tomatoes, a pitiful spoonful of gyro, a lackluster spoonful of beef, and 4 mini triangular pieces of pita bread. Unbeknownst to me, you are allowed to add onions, green onions, and olives as free extras, however I was uninformed of this by the busy staff. The employee then asked me if I would like white sauce, red sauce, or barbecue sauce but I asked for all three on the side (to get more quantity). To finish it all off, the staff placed my to-go meal in a high quality yellow Halal Guys plastic bag, which felt silky smooth and amazing to touch.  When I reached home, I was eager to try the food. I opened the legendary white sauce and drizzled it over my food. SO MUCH WHITE SAUCE. I sampled the rice alone and found it excessively greasy, but satisfying. The crunchy water and flavorless tomatoes added meaningless bulk to the meal. Both of the meats, gyro and beef, tasted average and were not horrible, but were not amazing either. The flavor particularly came from the white sauce and red sauce. The legendary white sauce was creamy and delicious, tasting like ranch dressing but with less kick. However, spoon after spoon of creamy, fattening white sauce with the greasy orange rice had my taste buds begging for something new. I drizzled the red sauce over the platter and was in for a surprise. This sauce was made for Satan himself. While not adding spicy flavor to the meal, the sauce tasted extremely hot and added excitement and variety to the greasy repetitive nature of the meal. The mini pita pieces were soft and delicious (I would recommend adding an extra pita for a dollar).   After return visits to the restaurant, I have found the food tasting dull, greasy, and flavorless, even in spite of adding the optional extras and trying their hummus. I also observed a decline in the quality of service they provide. On one visit, two of the employees looked stoned (which I do not mind), but they forgot to include my white and red sauce on the side in the bag, the very essence of Halal Guys. On two other visits, I was charged different amounts for the same combination platter I usually get. The staff is not as friendly as they initially were, and the overall food quality has declined from its initial opening. I would not expect more from a fast food restaurant but I was hoping for more.  Despite my critique of the store, I was initially astonished and satisfied by the food. For 8.99$, the quantity of food is decent and Halal Guys offers a fresh take on fast food in the Tempe-ASU area. Additionally, the hours are great, midnight on most days and 4AM on Saturday.
